0.title: When daughter saw poster of Abhay 2, she asked 'Why is daddy so angry': Kunal
0.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has said when his four-year-old daughter, Inaaya, saw the poster of the web show 'Abhay 2', she asked, "Why is he (Kunal) looking so angry?" "Then we made her understand papa is playing a cop, whose job is to scare people," he added. "She has an idea that we do something where we get respected," Kunal said.

1.title: Prima facie proof that Deshmukh used influence in police transfers: Court
1.article_body: Rejecting former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's bail, a court said that there is prima facie proof that he exercised his influence in the transfer of police officials. He was arrested in November 2021 by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money-laundering case. Deshmukh was accused of accepting bribes along with the co-accused Sachin Waze.

2.title: Can't penalise parties for not fulfilling promises: Allahabad HC
2.article_body: The Allahabad High Court observed that political parties can't be penalised for being unable to fulfil the promises made in their election manifesto. The court ruled after dismissing the petition filed by Khurshidurehman S Rehman who sought a criminal case against the BJP for allegedly failing to fulfil the promises made during the Lok Sabha elections in 2014.

3.title: Chennai boy solves Rubik's Cube in 14.32 secs on bicycle, sets Guinness World Record
3.article_body: A boy from Chennai has created a Guinness World Record by solving Rubik's Cube in just 14.32 seconds while riding a bicycle after working on his skills for two years. "Jayadharshan Venkatesan...was steering, pedalling and solving this cube whilst keeping his balance," Guinness World Records said, sharing his video on Instagram. Jayadharshan's achievement is put under the category of "speedcubing".

4.title: Mumbai Police removes 358 abandoned vehicles causing traffic congestion in city
4.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday removed 358 abandoned vehicles, which were clogging the roads leading to traffic congestion and bottlenecks in the city. Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey took to Twitter to say that police are now looking for bigger lorries to move the abandoned vehicles to Deonar. Pandey said police received "great support" from the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

5.title: Man stabs teacher 101 times, 30 years after "humiliation" at school in Belgium
5.article_body: A 37-year-old man who said he felt "humiliated" by his teacher in primary school has confessed to stabbing her to death in 2020, Belgian prosecutors said on Thursday. Gunter Uwents, who stabbed the teacher 101 times, said he never got over comments Maria Verlinden made about him in early 1990s. The murder had gone unsolved despite repeated Belgian police enquiries.

6.title: Wealthy Russians have up to $214 billion stashed in Swiss bank accounts
6.article_body: Wealthy Russians have stashed up to $214 billion in secretive Swiss bank accounts, the Swiss Bankers Association (SBA) has revealed. However, SBA said the amount of Russian wealth held in Switzerland was small compared with total assets held in the country. Switzerland "must do everything possible to turn off the money taps", Social Democrats' co-president Mattea Meyer said.

7.title: Chinese jet enters Taiwan air defence zone; 12th intrusion this month
7.article_body: Chinese fighter jet entered Taiwan's air defence identification zone (ADIZ) on Thursday, marking the 12th intrusion this month. In response, Taiwan issued radio warnings, sent planes, and deployed air defence missile systems to track the Chinese aircraft. Reportedly, 38 Chinese planes, including 26 fighter jets and nine spotter planes, have been spotted in Taiwan's ADIZ in March so far.

8.title: US man caring for his partner in Ukraine hospital killed while waiting in bread line
8.article_body: A US citizen who had been caring for his partner in a Ukrainian hospital was killed by Russian fire as he waited in a bread line after briefly stepping out to buy food, his family said on Thursday. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken confirmed the death of the American, identified by his sisters as Jimmy Hill.

9.title: 3 arrested in connection with 60 chain-snatching incidents in NCR in 2 yrs
9.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested three persons in connection with at least 60 incidents of chain-snatching in National Capital Region (NCR) in the past two years. Police have also seized a motorcycle, a gold chain, a locally-made revolver and three live cartridges from the accused. Police added that the accused confessed to committing chain-snatching in Rewari, Dharuhera and Gurugram.

10.title: Pressure tournaments are coming, want to see how Rohit reacts: Hogg
10.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said he wants to see how Team India captain Rohit Sharma reacts under pressure, with crucial tournaments like a four-match Test series at home against Australia coming up. "Will he keep that same calm body language or will we see a little bit of temper?" added Hogg. "[It will]...be tough for Rohit," stated Hogg.

11.title: Delhi records season's warmest day as temperature rises to 36.1°C
11.article_body: Delhi on Thursday recorded the season's warmest day as the maximum temperature reached 36.1°C, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "In the coming days, the temperature is expected to rise but it will not touch 40°C as there would be winds," an IMD scientist RK Jenamani added. The minimum temperature in Delhi on Thursday was recorded at 19.9°C, IMD stated.

12.title: 88-yr-old man booked for raping 11-yr-old girl kills self in Gurugram
12.article_body: An 88-year-old man, who was booked for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl, died by suicide in Gurugram, police said. The girl's mother alleged that the suspect lured her daughter by offering her a sweet and raped her at his house, police added. The man allegedly killed himself after he came to know that the victim's family had approached the police.

13.title: 15 arrested for pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar
13.article_body: At least 15 persons have been arrested for allegedly pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar. The incident took place after three terrorists were killed in an encounter and the site was being cleared to ensure citizens' safety, police said. "In order to disperse the mob, smoke shells had to be used," police added in a statement.

14.title: Italy ready to rebuild bombed Ukrainian theatre: Culture Min
14.article_body: Italy is ready to rebuild a theatre in the besieged Ukrainian city Mariupol which was destroyed by a bomb attack, Culture Minister Dario Franceschini said. According to Ukrainian authorities, the theatre was bombed by Russia while people were sheltering in it. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked the minister. "Together we will rebuild the country to the last brick," Zelenskyy said.

15.title: What could become costlier in India due to the war in Ukraine?
15.article_body: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.

16.title: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
16.article_body: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.

17.title: Horse mussels under threat due to conservation failures: Study
17.article_body: Horse mussels, a species of giant mollusc found in the UK waters could be at risk due to unprotected areas of the sea, a study has found. Marine experts have described the beds of these molluscs as biodiversity hotspots. Marine protected areas (MPAs) were also introduced to protect them but due to conservation failure, the species is at risk.

18.title: Who is a war criminal?
18.article_body: The term 'war criminal' applies to anyone who violates a set of rules adopted by world leaders known as the law of armed conflict. The rules govern how countries behave in times of war. The violations of the rules that amount to war crimes include deliberately targeting civilians, using disproportionate force, using human shields and taking hostages.

19.title: Pune Metro to rename Bhosari, Budhwar Peth stations after citizens complain
19.article_body: The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited, which is implementing the Pune Metro project, has decided to change the names of at least two stations – Bhosari and Budhwar Peth. Officials said they have been receiving complaints regarding the names of the two stations due to confusion among commuters. "We will soon send a request to the...state government," an official said.

20.title: 53-yr-old man gets life sentence for raping minor stepdaughter in Maha
20.article_body: A sessions court in Palghar convicted a 53-year-old man for raping his 15-year-old stepdaughter and sentenced him to life in jail. In an FIR filed in 2017, the girl had alleged her step-father continued to rape her even after she became pregnant. Her mother had married the accused after the girl's father passed away when she was six months old.

21.title: Aishwarya remembers dad on death anniversary, shares his old pic with Aaradhya
21.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post remembering her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of her father with his granddaughter Aaradhya, and wrote, "Love you eternally dearest darling daddyyy-ajjaaa. Our guardian-angel forever and beyond…thank youuu and love you."

22.title: His defence was not the greatest: Harbhajan on Ponting's 'vulnerability'
22.article_body: Discussing Ricky Ponting whom he dismissed 10 times in Tests, more than any other bowler, Harbhajan Singh said, "Ponting used to defend with very hard hands...That...made him vulnerable. His defence was not the greatest." "My bounce was something he could not play as well as...other bowlers," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan dismissed Ponting to record his 300th Test wicket in 2008.

23.title: Bulgarian Police detain former PM Borissov after EU probes
23.article_body: Bulgarian former PM Boyko Borissov was detained on Thursday as part of a police operation linked to probes by the EU Public Prosecutor's Office, the Interior Ministry said. Prosecutors have opened 120 investigations of fraud in Bulgaria involving EU funds. Former Finance Minister Vladislav Goranov and former head of the parliamentary budgetary commission, Menda Stoyanova, have also been detained.

24.title: Sonali recreates old pics from 1998 film 'Duplicate' sets with Geeta
24.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share some pictures from the dance rehearsals of the song 'Tum Nahin Jaana' from her 1998 movie 'Duplicate'. The pictures also featured choreographer Geeta Kapur. Sonali also shared pictures of herself and Geeta recreating those old pictures on a reality show. "Circa 1996! So many memories come flooding back with these photos," she wrote.

25.title: AAP MLA from Punjab's Nabha cycles 80 km for swearing-in ceremony
25.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Punjab's Nabha (SC Reserve) Gurdev Singh Dev Mann cycled for 80 kilometres for his swearing-in ceremony as a legislator in Punjab Vidhan Sabha on Thursday. He travelled 80 kilometres one way from Nabha to Chandigarh on a cycle. Mann announced that he would take a token amount of ₹1 per month as an MLA.

26.title: Professor of law university in MP booked for sexually harassing 2 students
26.article_body: A professor of the National Law Institute University (NLIU) in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, who recently resigned over allegations of sexual harassment, has been booked for sexually harassing two students, police said. As per reports, the students have accused the professor of sending obscene messages and videos on their phones and asking them to meet him at his residence.

27.title: Nothing wrong with it: Arunoday on losing roles to more famous actors
27.article_body: Actor Arunoday Singh revealed that he has lost out on opportunities that went to bigger stars, adding that there's nothing wrong with it. Stating that the bigger stars make a project more viable, he said, "They give the project a bigger length." "That's how it works. That's my point. That's the natural way of the industry," Arunoday said.

28.title: No advantage for MI: Zaheer on IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai, Pune
28.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said there would be no advantage for the franchise with IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai and Pune, as MI won't be playing all their matches at Wankhede Stadium. Fifty-five league matches will be played at Brabourne Stadium, Wankhede Stadium and DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26.

29.title: What are MANPADS, the defence systems securing Ukraine?
29.article_body: MANPADS (Man-portable air-defence systems) are short-range surface-to-air missiles used to intercept fixed- and rotary-wing aircraft in flight. They are designed to be fired while mounted on a person's shoulder or a tripod. The US had already sent Ukraine more than 600 Stingers – a type of man-portable air defence system, amid the ongoing invasion by Russia.

30.title: Taliban to open high schools for girls next week, only female teachers for them
30.article_body: Taliban will allow girls in Afghanistan to return to class when high schools open next week, a Ministry of Education spokesperson said, months after uncertainty over full education access to girls. "There are some conditions for girls," he said, adding that female students would be taught separately from males and only by female teachers, except in areas where there's shortage.

31.title: AAP might pick Harbhajan, Chadha for Rajya Sabha from Punjab: Reports
31.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is likely to nominate Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha and IIT-Delhi Associate Professor Sandeep Pathak to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab, reports said. The elections to five out of the seven RS seats of Punjab will be held on March 31. "These are the three frontrunners for the three seats for now," said a source.

32.title: Film industry must also implement POSH Act: Kerala HC
32.article_body: The Kerala High Court asked movie production houses to form an internal complaints committee to deal with cases of women's sexual harassment, under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act of 2013 commonly known as POSH Act. An organisation with less than 10 female employees must make complaints to local complaints committee, the HC said.

33.title: Madrasa teacher arrested for sheltering terrorists at home in Bengal's Howrah
33.article_body: A madrasa teacher has been arrested for allegedly sheltering militants of banned terrorist group Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) at his rented house in Bankra in West Bengal's Howrah district. The accused has been sent to police custody for 12 days. The Special Task Force (STF) of the West Bengal Police is investigating if the accused was directly involved in terror activities.

34.title: Congress could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat: Congress' Tewari
34.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari has said the party could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat. "We lost in 2014 and 2019...Since 2014, out of 49 Assembly elections, we have lost 39 polls. We have only won four elections...therefore we are really looking at an extremely grim situation," he added. "The situation does not call for introspection alone," he further said.

35.title: 8 cyclones formed over 129 years in March, only 2 crossed coasts: IMD
35.article_body: Only eight cyclones have been formed in the month of March in over 129 years between 1891 and 2020, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Only two cyclones crossed the coast, one in 1926 and the other in 1907, IMD added. Of the eight cyclones, two have been formed in the Arabian Sea and six in the Bay of Bengal.

36.title: Dirty Russian tricks: UK Defence Min after a call from 'fake Ukraine PM'
36.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace on Thursday ordered an inquiry after an imposter claiming to be the Ukrainian PM called him. The imposter "posed several misleading questions and after becoming suspicious I terminated the call", Wallace said. "No amount of Russian disinformation, distortion and dirty tricks can distract from Russia's human rights abuses and illegal invasion of Ukraine," he added.

37.title: Pune man arrested for killing labourer, dumping body on river bank
37.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a labourer and dumping his body on banks of river Mula in Pune. Both of them worked together. "One of them had sold a phone to the other...A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

38.title: 4 held for selling fake helicopter tickets to Mata Vaishno Devi pilgrims
38.article_body: Jammu Cyber Police with the help of Rajasthan Police arrested four persons for allegedly duping pilgrims under the name of providing helicopter tickets for Mata Vaishno Devi shrine through fake websites. After receiving complaint from Mata Vaishno Devi shrine board, police identified 40 fake ticket booking websites and tracked four fraudsters through their IP address who were operating from Kota.

39.title: Letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib during partition was a mistake: Shah
39.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing an event organised by Land Ports Authority of India (LPAI), said letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib gurdwara during partition was a "mistake" as it was just six kilometres away. "I don't know what went wrong. But when a festival of first Guru used to come along, there always was a feeling of sadness," he added.

40.title: Pant calmed down when close to fastest Test fifty causing his downfall: Hogg
40.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in India's Bengaluru Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pant calmed down while approaching the record causing his downfall. Pant was dismissed by Praveen Jayawickrama off the third ball after reaching the milestone. "All of a sudden, he was second guessing," added Hogg.

41.title: Don't want you to be broken like my dad who fought for Nazis: Arnold to Russian troops
41.article_body: In an appeal to Russian troops in Ukraine, actor Arnold Schwarzenegger said he doesn't want them to be "broken" like his father who fought for the Nazis during World War II. "My father...was...pumped up on the lies of his government. When he left Leningrad he was broken physically and mentally," he recalled. "This is an illegal war," Schwarzenegger stated.

42.title: India reports 2,528 COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries in the 24 hours
42.article_body: India has reported 2,528 new COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries, and 149 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,539 cases and 60 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,281, while the active caseload declined to 29,181.

43.title: Nawab Malik's portfolios to be temporarily given to his colleagues: NCP
43.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has decided to "temporarily" give charge of portfolios held by jailed Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik to his cabinet colleagues from the party in the next two to four days, NCP leader Jayant Patil said. "He'll continue to be a Minister. We're not taking his resignation," Patil added. Malik was arrested "in a wrong manner", he stated.

44.title: Never wanted any player to restrain: Kumble on KL Rahul's strike rate
44.article_body: Talking about ex-Punjab Kings captain KL Rahul who drew criticism for his strike rate while leading the franchise, PBKS head coach Anil Kumble said, "I don't think we ever wanted any player to restrain himself." Rahul batted at strike rates of 129.34, 138.80 in the two seasons when he led PBKS. He will lead Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2022.

45.title: Brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots gets state government job
45.article_body: Delhi government appointed Ankur Sharma, brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in northeast Delhi riots in February 2020, in the state's education department. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal handed him over the appointment letter on Thursday. "We can never compensate...the loss...but I hope this...job and assistance of ₹1 crore brings the family strength," he tweeted.

46.title: It's been really scary: Justin Bieber on blood clot in wife Hailey's brain
46.article_body: Commenting on his wife Hailey Baldwin's recent medical emergency, singer Justin Bieber said, "It's been scary, you know, it's been really scary. But I know for a fact that God has her in palms of his hands, and that's a good thing." Earlier, Baldwin said she is "doing well" after experiencing stroke-like symptoms from a blood clot in her brain.

47.title: I-T dept makes highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22
47.article_body: The Income Tax department has made the highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22, according to CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra. The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.

48.title: Urge India to speak out against Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine: US politicians
48.article_body: In a call with the Ambassador of India to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu, US politicians Ro Khanna and Joe Wilson urged India to speak out against Russia President Vladimir Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine. "On both sides of the aisle, friends of India are urging India to use its influence for peace," Khanna tweeted.

49.title: Australian PM posts message on Holi, says 'Holi holds even more meaning this year'
49.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison posted a message on Holi and wrote, "Namaste to all my Indian Australian friends celebrating the Festival of Colours. I want to thank Indian Australian community for the love and care you have shown...to all Australians." "The ancient Festival of Colours gathers people together for a joyous celebration...Holi holds even more meaning this year," he wrote.

50.title: Kapil Sharma, Nandita Das meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik amid film shoot
50.article_body: Kapil Sharma and filmmaker Nandita Das met Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Thursday. Sharing some pictures from the meeting on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting the honourable CM of Odisha Shri Naveen Patnaik...Thank you for...making us feel at home. Your heart is as beautiful as your state." Kapil and Nandita are shooting for a film in Bhubaneswar.

51.title: US Senators introduce bill to ban imports of Russian uranium
51.article_body: US Republican Senators have introduced a bill to ban imports of Russian uranium in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Earlier, US President Joe Biden had announced a ban on Russian oil, gas, and energy imports. "Banning Russian uranium imports will further defund Russia's war machine, help revive American uranium production, and increase our national security," Senator John Barrasso said.

52.title: Madras HC rejects plea challenging O Panneerselvam's assembly win
52.article_body: The Madras High Court rejected a voter's plea which challenged AIADMK's senior leader O Panneerselvam's election from Bodinayakanur in last year's Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Petitioner alleged that Panneerselvam had "declared false income details in his election affidavit". The plea was rejected after Panneerselvam countered by stating that he had already "declared income details".

53.title: Behave politely with patients: Punjab health department to govt hospital staff
53.article_body: Punjab government's department of health and family welfare directed the staff of all government hospitals to behave politely with patients and maintain cleanliness in hospitals. Issuing the directions, Gurinder Bir Singh, Director, Health and Family Welfare, said, "Ensure availability of free medicine and tests for the patients...Wearing uniforms must be made mandatory for the hospital staff."

54.title: 4-yr-old girl dies after airgun misfires while playing at farmhouse near Hyd
54.article_body: A four-year-old girl died at a farmhouse in Telangana's Sangareddy district near Hyderabad after an airgun misfired, leading to a bullet injury on her head. Police have detained the owner of the farmhouse for negligence and the 17-year-old son of a watchman's relative for pressing the trigger while playing with the airgun.

55.title: UK to deploy Sky Sabre missile defence system to Poland amid Ukraine war
55.article_body: The UK will deploy its Sky Sabre medium-range anti-air missile system to Poland with about 100 personnel to strengthen the security of NATO's eastern flank, Defence Minister Ben Wallace said, amid the Ukraine war. This will help Poland "protect its airspace from any further aggression from Russia", Wallace added. Reportedly, Sky Sabre can launch missiles at speeds of 2,300 mph.

56.title: 7 held for operating fake angadia firm, cheating Mumbai businessman of ₹2 crore
56.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly operating a fake angadia firm and cheating a city-based businessman of ₹2 crore. Angadia firms offer courier services to deliver money, jewellery and other valuables. The accused had allegedly taken the money from the businessman to deliver it to someone in Assam, but they did not do so, police added.

57.title: 2 Indian nationals detained at Delhi airport, 250 riflescopes recovered
57.article_body: Two Indian nationals were detained on Thursday at Delhi airport on their arrival from Bangkok. At least 250 pieces of riflescopes were recovered from their baggage. "Riflescope is a restricted item for import, and also attracts action under the Arms Act," a customs official said. CISF personnel on Wednesday caught three passengers travelling with forged documents at Delhi airport.

58.title: PM Modi, President Kovind extend greetings to nation on Holi
58.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday greeted the nation on the occasion of Holi. "May this festival of colours, a symbol of mutual love, affection and brotherhood, bring every colour of happiness in your life," PM Modi tweeted. "I wish that this festival infuses joy, enthusiasm...in the lives of all the countrymen," President Kovind said.

59.title: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets killed in Russian rocket attack
59.article_body: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets has been killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv. Shvets had been awarded one of Ukraine's highest artistic honours. "Bright memory to the talented actress! There is no forgiveness for the enemy that has come to our land," her troupe, the Young Theater, said in a statement.

60.title: Putin is a murderous dictator, a pure thug waging an immoral war: Joe Biden
60.article_body: US President Joe Biden during an address for St Patrick's Day said Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a murderous dictator, a pure thug who is waging an immoral war against the people of Ukraine". He added that the US and Ireland are working together for the first time now and "Putin is paying a big price for his aggression".

61.title: 8 workers injured as fire breaks out at industrial scrap processing unit in Pune
61.article_body: Eight persons sustained burn injuries after a fire broke out at an industrial scrap processing unit in Pune's Moshi, where used oil barrels were being cleaned. Police claimed the incident took place when oil removed from the barrels came in contact with the flame of the furnace, which was being used to heat water. The unit's owner has been booked.

62.title: Lakshya Sen defeats world no. 3 Antonsen to enter All England quarterfinals
62.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen defeated world number three Anders Antonsen in straight games to reach the men's singles quarterfinals of the All England Championships on Thursday. Lakshya defeated Antonsen with a scoreline of 21-16, 21-18. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal were knocked out after losing their respective women's singles' matches in the second round.

63.title: Real Madrid to donate €1 million to Ukrainian refugees
63.article_body: Real Madrid on Wednesday said they will donate €1 million to help Ukrainian refugees as part of their "Everyone with Ukraine" campaign, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The club said the money will be donated to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the Red Cross. The UNHCR said nearly three million refugees have fled Ukraine so far.

64.title: Chinese 'manja' injures Black Kite; found hanging from tree in Agra
64.article_body: A juvenile Black Kite was injured by the Chinese 'manja' and was found hanging from a tree in Agra's Chhipitola. The bird was rescued by the Wildlife SOS Rapid Response Unit and is being currently kept under medical observation. "While the injuries are minor, the kite is unable to fly," said Dr Ilayaraja, Deputy Director, Veterinary Services for Wildlife SOS.

65.title: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
65.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.

66.title: Want diplomatic solution to Ukraine crisis, war must stop: Uzbekistan
66.article_body: Uzbekistan on Thursday called for a diplomatic solution to the Russian invasion in Ukraine, adding that it won't recognise Ukraine's breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent. Uzbek Foreign Minister Abdulaziz Kamilov said that while it wants good ties with both Russia and Ukraine, war "must stop immediately". Uzbekistan has also said it will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

67.title: I am not in favour or against: Nadal on new tie-break system at GS
67.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he is "not in favour or against" the new 10-point tie-break when the score is 6-6 in the deciding set, which will be trialled at all four Grand Slams. "Well, I don't care much honestly. I honestly don't have a clear opinion," the 21-time Grand Slam champion said.

68.title: People only came to me with biopics after 'The Dirty Picture': Vidya
68.article_body: Vidya Balan revealed people only offered her biopics after her film 'The Dirty Picture'. "Meena Kumari, MS Subbulakshmi, Kiran Bedi...There were 10 of them that came to me at that time," she stated. Vidya, who had announced a web series on ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 2018, was asked if it's still happening. To this, she replied, "I'd hope so."

69.title: 28-yr-old stabs father to death for objecting to alcoholism in TN
69.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested in Chennai on Thursday for allegedly stabbing his father, who used to scold him over his alcoholism and for not doing any work, police said. The accused stabbed his father after the two got into a heated argument on Wednesday night, according to the police. The accused was arrested from a hideout, police added.

70.title: Smoke from a huge fire at Walmart warehouse in US visible from space
70.article_body: A plume of smoke emitted from a huge fire at a Walmart distribution centre in Plainfield, US, was so vast that it could be seen from space on Wednesday afternoon, Bloomberg said. A clip posted on Twitter by National Weather Service gave a satellite's-eye view of the smoke spreading across the surrounding area. Twenty-four fire departments are fighting the fire.

71.title: Govt reacts as judge Bhandari votes against Russia, says 'voted in individual capacity'
71.article_body: On being asked about Indian judge Dalveer Bhandari's vote against Russia at International Court of Justice, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "He happens to be an Indian national who's a member in his individual capacity on the ICJ." "I am not going to comment on how judges vote on issues that come to the ICJ," he added.

72.title: Man kidnaps & rapes minor girl in Delhi, arrested after shootout
72.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor girl in Delhi. According to the police, the accused fired at a team when they tried to arrest him on Thursday, and he sustained a bullet injury following an exchange of fire. The police received information about his movement on Thursday, said DCP (Outer-north) Brijendra Kumar Yadav.

73.title: Marriage was never part of my imagination: Actor Rahul Bose
73.article_body: Rahul Bose revealed that, at the age of 18, he had said that he'll never get married. "My mother said, 'That's ok, we will see five or ten years from now'. If she had been alive today, she probably would have realised that I just knew," he added. "Love, togetherness, companionships? Yes...But marriage...was never part of my imagination," Rahul stated.

74.title: Films should be made on Emergency & 'firing on Ram bhakts': BJP MP
74.article_body: BJP MP Mukesh Rajput on Thursday praised 'The Kashmir Files' and stated that movies should also be made on 1975-77 Emergency and alleged firing on Ram bhakts during ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's tenure. "People should know which CM and PM committed atrocities,” he said. 'The Kashmir Files' has revealed massacre of Kashmiri Pandits which was kept hidden, Rajput added.

75.title: Stress-free Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition: Glenn Maxwell
75.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has said that stress-free Virat Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition now that he won't be captaining the side. Maxwell added, "It is amazing for him to be relaxed a bit and actually enjoy the next few years of his career without any of that sort of external pressure."

76.title: Message to save water on Holi is cultural terrorism: MP minister
76.article_body: The message to save water on Holi is an attack on Hindu festivals and is cultural terrorism, Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "How much water do we use during Holi? Save water throughout the year...Why does such a message revolve around our festivals only?" Sarang asked. He said the message was aimed at distancing youth from Hindu festivals.

77.title: Excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' shoot wraps up: Mohit
77.article_body: Director Mohit Suri has announced that the shooting of 'Ek Villain Returns' has been completed. Taking to Twitter, Mohit wrote, "The excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' wraps up...with Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria." He further added that the movie will release on July 8 across theatres. The film is the sequel to the 2014 film 'Ek Villain'.

78.title: BSF personnel dance, sing 'Rang barse' on Holi eve; video surfaces
78.article_body: Personnel of the Border Security Force (BSF) posted in Jammu's Gajansoo area celebrated Holi by playing dhol and singing Bollywood songs. In a 0.52-second video that had surfaced on Twitter, the personnel can be heard singing Holi song 'Rang barse'. They also danced to the song and played with colours.

79.title: Form panels to stop harassment of women: Kerala HC to film bodies
79.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Thursday said that film bodies and production houses have the responsibility to form an Internal Complaints Committee (ICC), as per the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace Act, 2013. "It's only a question on the formation of it and it could be either done by the Producer's Association or the Chamber," said Producer Suresh Kumar.

80.title: Woman revenue official dies by suicide in MP; no suicide note found
80.article_body: A 30-year-old woman revenue official allegedly died by suicide in Bhedaghat of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district on Thursday, police said. The incident came to light when she didn't respond to repeated knocks on the door of her house and could not be reached by neighbours, said Bhedaghat police station in-charge, Shafique Khan. No suicide note was recovered, he added.

81.title: Having gujiya was what I loved about Holi: Manushi Chhillar
81.article_body: Former Miss World Manushi Chhillar recalled celebrating Holi in her childhood and said, "I still remember having a small pink pichkari (water gun) going around with my friends, being very excited about Holi." She further added that having gujiya was what she loved about the festival. Manushi will mark her Bollywood debut with 'Prithviraj'.

82.title: AAP ended corruption in Delhi, Mann will end it in Punjab: Kejriwal
82.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that his government eradicated corruption in Delhi, adding that the new Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann will end corruption in the state as well. He also welcomed Mann's decision of releasing a WhatsApp number on March 23, for people to share recordings if government officials ask for bribes from them.

83.title: 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 cr seized by BSF near B'desh border
83.article_body: The South Bengal Frontier of the Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 crore from an alleged smuggler, who was trying to smuggle the gold from Bangladesh to India. According to reports, troops noticed the movements of a suspect, who, upon being confronted by a jawan, threw the bag and escaped towards Bangladesh.

84.title: 23-yr-old woman's burnt body found in Nagpur; petrol cans recovered
84.article_body: A 23-year-old woman's half-burnt body was recovered by the police from a secluded place in Nagpur's Surabardi on Wednesday and empty petrol bottles were found near the body of the deceased. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone I) Lohit Matani said that she had been missing since Tuesday and her family had filed a complaint at the Ranapratap Nagar police station.

85.title: Over 100 civilians rescued from theatre bombed by Russia: Reports
85.article_body: Over 100 civilians on Thursday were reportedly rescued from a theatre in Mariupol that was bombed by Russia on March 16. Ukrainian officials said thousands of people, including children, had sought refuge in the theatre. Officials said 79 children have died so far and over 100 have been injured since the invasion by Russia began on February 24.

86.title: BJP leadership will choose next Manipur CM: Thongam Biswajit Singh
86.article_body: Manipur BJP leader Thongam Biswajit Singh said on Thursday that the party leadership will decide who becomes the state’s next CM. "BJP is a democratic party...I think they will have a talk with all our legislators before a decision is made,” he added. Singh's comments come amid speculations of him being a front runner for the position.

87.title: ACB seizes over ₹27 lakh cash from PWD official accused of bribery
87.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has allegedly seized over ₹27 lakh cash from an engineer of the Public Works Department (PWD), booked in a bribery case in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district. Sanjay Patil, 52, was allegedly also caught accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 from a contractor on March 12. The ACB also found 183 gm of gold at Patil's house.

88.title: People throw slippers during Holi celebrations at Patna water park
88.article_body: People were seen hurling slippers and shoes at one another while playing Holi at a water park in Patna, a video of which surfaced on social media on Thursday. As per reports, the operators of the park repeatedly asked people to stop throwing slippers but they didn't listen. Subsequently, the authorities had to fire air guns to calm the people.

89.title: Russian soldiers made to say 'Putin is a di**head' after being captured
89.article_body: Russian soldiers captured by Ukrainian forces were forced to say "Putin is a di**head", a video of which has also surfaced online. They were also made to call Russian government  "scumbags". Dressed in military clothing and a black hat, one captive said, "I really love [my wife] and I hope that she will forgive me for coming here."

90.title: Bihar-born Dr Ashish Jha named White House COVID-19 response coordinator
90.article_body: US President Joe Biden has appointed Indian-American physician Dr Ashish Jha as the new White House COVID-19 response coordinator. President Biden said Jha is "one of the leading public health experts in America" and described him as the "perfect person for the job". The 51-year-old Bihar-born Jha said, "I'm deeply honoured for this chance to serve this country I love."

91.title: Engaged US couple diagnosed with cancer 8 days apart; prepones wedding
91.article_body: An engaged couple from the US, who were about to get married in June 2022, preponed their wedding to April 9 after both the partners were diagnosed with cancer. While 23-year-old Mariah Nelesen was diagnosed with ovarian cancer on January 11, 24-year-old Clay Slenk was diagnosed with Leukaemia eight days later. "There'll be a little more...sickness before health," Clay said.

92.title: Prithvi Shaw shares quote on 'karma' after reportedly failing Yo-Yo test
92.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram Stories to share a quote on 'karma' after reports said that he failed a Yo-Yo test at a camp at the NCA in Bengaluru. "[Please] don't judge me when you don't know my situation, [you] are creating your own karma," the quote read. The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

93.title: This looks superb and so inviting: Mahindra on pics of new highway in Manipur
93.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has praised a new highway built in Manipur. Retweeting a post by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari that featured a few photos of the Wangjing-Khonkhang section of NH-39 in Manipur, Mahindra wrote, "This looks superb and so inviting. The magic of Manipur is now much more accessible. These highways will knit India together even more tightly."

94.title: Bhagwant Mann celebrates Holi with Haryana CM, pics surface
94.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday celebrated Holi with his Haryana counterpart Manohar Lal Khattar at the Haryana Raj Bhawan in Chandigarh. The Raj Bhawan has shared pictures of the 'Holi Milan Samaroh'. Mann took oath as the Punjab Chief Minister at Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh, on Wednesday.

95.title: European Space Agency suspends joint mission to Mars with Russia
95.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) on Thursday said it has suspended the launch of ExoMars, its joint mission to Mars with Russia's space agency Roscosmos, over the invasion of Ukraine. "While recognising the impact of scientific exploration of space, the ESA is fully aligned with sanctions imposed on Russia by its member states," the ESA said.

96.title: China should take more effective measures: Xi amid rising COVID cases
96.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country, Chinese President Xi Jinping has urged the country to take more effective COVID-19 measures and minimise the impact of the epidemic on economic development, state television reported on Thursday. Millions of people in northeastern China are reportedly under lockdown as over two dozen regions have reported COVID-19 infections in the past few weeks.

97.title: OYO appoints Ankit Gupta as India CEO, Rohit Kapoor as global CMO ahead of IPO
97.article_body: IPO-bound OYO has elevated Ankit Gupta to the post of India CEO, while transitioning India and Southeast Asia CEO Rohit Kapoor will now work as the company's global Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). OYO's Southeast Asia operations will now be handled by global Chief Business Officer Ankit Tandon. This comes amid reports that OYO may slash its IPO valuation by half.

98.title: I've taken responsibility for Cong's U'khand poll defeat: Rawat
98.article_body: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said he has taken responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly polls. "If I can't control mayhem in my own house (Congress), then I don't have the right to comment on BJP's CM face," Rawat said. He added that BJP coined the term 'Muslim University' and blamed him for religious polarisation.

99.title: Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD, CEO extended for 3 more months
99.article_body: RBI on Thursday extended Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD and CEO for three more months with effect from March 25, the bank said. Ahuja was appointed as the interim MD and CEO on December 25 after former chief Vishwavir Ahuja's abrupt exit. In an unusual move, RBI also appointed an Additional Director on the bank's board.

100.title: Direct tax collection in FY22 stands at ₹13.63 lakh cr: CBDT chief
100.article_body: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said direct tax collection for FY22 outmatches revised estimates of ₹12.5 lakh crore after touching ₹13.63 lakh crore. He added that government's cumulative collection through tax deducted at source currently stood at ₹6.79 lakh crore and corporate tax collection stood at ₹7.19 lakh crore. "The numbers are more than what we expected," he said.

101.title: Anti-BJP alliance leader can only be chosen after LS polls: Yechury
101.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has said that the leader of an anti-BJP alliance can only be chosen after 2024 Lok Sabha elections and not prior to it. The front cannot be formed pre-polls given the diversity of India, Yechury stated. His remarks come amid ongoing efforts by Opposition leaders, including TMC's Mamata Banerjee, to forge alternate national front without Congress.

102.title: Daughter not entitled to father's money if she's unwilling to maintain ties with him: SC
102.article_body: While hearing a divorce case, the Supreme Court said that a daughter isn't entitled to any amount from her father for her education or marriage if she doesn't want to maintain any relationship with him. However, the court also said that it must be ensured that a sufficient amount is available with the mother to support the daughter.

103.title: Bhagavad Gita to be part of school syllabus for Classes 6-12: Gujarat govt
103.article_body: Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani said on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be part of the school syllabus for Classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23. "For students of Classes 6- 8, the scripture will be introduced in the textbook of...holistic education. From Classes 9-12, it'll be introduced in form of storytelling in textbook of the first language," he explained.

104.title: UN establishes formal ties with Taliban-run Afghanistan
104.article_body: The UN Security Council voted on Thursday to establish formal ties with Taliban-run Afghanistan, which is yet to be recognised globally. Ireland said that the resolution, which has been passed six months after the Taliban takeover, will address urgent needs of the Afghan people, support women's participation and protect human rights.

105.title: IDFC FIRST Bank's CEO gifts 5,00,000 shares to family of a deceased colleague
105.article_body: IDFC FIRST Bank's MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 5,00,000 shares of the bank to family members of a deceased colleague. The deceased colleague was "closely known" to Vaidyanathan and the shares have been gifted to back the family's education and financial security, the bank said. Earlier, Vaidyanathan gifted shares to five people including his driver and househelp.

106.title: Doctor Strange isn't an Avenger, he's outside of that realm: Benedict
106.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch has said that Doctor Strange isn't an Avenger. "I'm not at Stark Tower with Nick Fury. No, he's sort of outside of that realm," Benedict added. He stated Doctor Strange is there to protect the reality of the Avengers in a different way. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is expected to have cameos by MCU characters.

107.title: Kangana in talks with Vivek Agnihotri for his upcoming next: Report
107.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut is reportedly in talks with 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri for one of his upcoming projects. According to a source close to the development, "Vivek has been working on multiple ideas and...has discussed one of those with Kangana." "Talks are in very early stages...once they materialise, an official announcement will take place," the source added.

108.title: I've done favours for people in industry who lied to me: Shantanu
108.article_body: Shantanu Maheshwari, speaking about the entertainment industry, said, "People promise you, 'We'll work with you, [if] you do this as a favour'." However, added that they didn't live up to their word. Shantanu stated, "It feels like a betrayal because they promised certain things. So, why not live up to that promise?" Shantanu made his Bollywood debut with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'.

109.title: US Prez Biden to speak with Chinese Prez Xi over Ukraine crisis
109.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki has announced that the US President Joe Biden will hold a call on Friday with Chinese President Xi Jinping. Psaki said the call is part of ongoing US efforts to maintain open lines of communication between the two nations. "The...leaders will discuss managing...competition between our two countries [and] Russia’s war against Ukraine," Psaki added.

110.title: Liverpool beat Arsenal 2-0 to cut Man City’s lead in PL to 1 point
110.article_body: Liverpool on Wednesday beat Arsenal 2-0 to cut Manchester City's gap at the top of the Premier League to one point. Both Liverpool and Manchester City have played 29 games so far. Liverpool's victory was their ninth consecutive Premier League win. Diogo Jota and Roberto Firmino scored for Liverpool in the second-half. Arsenal play Aston Villa next on Saturday.

111.title: Need US' help to join NATO: Kosovo President amid Ukraine war
111.article_body: Kosovo's President Vjosa Osmani has written to her US counterpart Joe Biden, requesting him to use the US' "influence" in helping Kosovo join NATO amid Ukraine war. "We're exposed to persistent efforts by Russia to undermine Kosovo and destabilise the...Western Balkans," Osmani wrote. Notably, Russia doesn't recognise Kosovo as a sovereign country, which was earlier a breakaway province of Serbia.

112.title: Aston Martin's Vettel tests positive for COVID-19, to miss Bahrain GP
112.article_body: Aston Martin on Thursday announced that driver Sebastian Vettel has tested positive for COVID-19 and will miss the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. The four-time Formula One world champion will be replaced by Aston Martin's reserve driver Nico Hulkenberg. Vettel is the second driver to test positive recently after McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo tested positive last week.

113.title: World no. 4 Nadal beats Opelka to reach Indian Wells quarter-finals
113.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal on Wednesday beat Reilly Opelka 7-6(3), 7-6(5) to reach the quarter-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. The win extended Nadal's unbeaten run in the ATP Tour season to 18-0. "[Opelka] is one of the toughest opponents on Tour," Nadal, 35, said, who will now face Nick Kyrgios in the quarter-final.

114.title: McLaren F1 team announce multi-year partnership with Google
114.article_body: McLaren Formula One team on Wednesday announced a multi-year partnership with Google. The total value of the new deal is currently unknown. "We are absolutely delighted and proud to welcome Google to the McLaren Racing family," McLaren CEO Zak Brown said. The new partnership with McLaren will be Google's debut in Formula One.

115.title: OYO may slash its IPO size, expected valuation by half: Reports
115.article_body: IPO-bound OYO may slash its fundraising target of $1 billion by half or may even shelve the IPO launch altogether amid waning investor enthusiasm, Bloomberg reported. It's also considering halving its expected valuation from the $12 billion originally targeted. OYO had filed the draft red herring prospectus in September 2021 but is yet to get Indian market regulator SEBI's approval.

116.title: Political misfire: Ex-Guj CM Vaghela on giving Priyanka charge of UP
116.article_body: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela on Thursday said the decision to give Priyanka Gandhi Vadra charge of Congress in UP was a political misfire. He made the comments a day after attending the meeting of rebel Congress leaders. "G-23 isn't a revolt against the Congress...They just want to put forth concerns about the functioning of the party," he said.

117.title: Ukraine's youngest MP shares pics with girlfriend of 10 years killed in Russian shelling
117.article_body: Ukraine's youngest MP Sviatoslav Yurash took to Twitter to share pictures with his girlfriend, journalist Alexandra Kuvshynova, who was killed in Russian shelling. "Her I loved. Decade of happiness and sadness, joy and pain, meaning and loss. Only death could have parted us. Now I learn to hate. You shall never be forgotten. They shall never be forgiven," he wrote.

118.title: Audience will witness several twists in 'Bloody Brothers': Jaideep
118.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat, speaking about his upcoming web series 'Bloody Brothers', has said that the audience will witness several twists and turns in the show. "They will keep wondering what is happening and as the secrets of each character keep unravelling, the audiences definitely will be hooked on the show," he added. The show also features Zeeshan Ayyub.

119.title: Was offered Pegasus spyware 4-5 yrs ago for ₹25 cr, rejected offer: Mamata
119.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed on Thursday that Israeli cyber intelligence company NSO had approached the state police department four-five years ago to sell their Pegasus spyware for ₹25 crore. "I turned it down as it could have been used politically...which is not acceptable," she said. Banerjee has repeatedly accused BJP-led Centre of using Pegasus for spying on opponents.

120.title: 15-20 Indians still in Ukraine who want to get evacuated: MEA
120.article_body: As per the Indian government's assessment, there are still 15 to 20 people stranded in Ukraine who want to get evacuated, MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Thursday. He said, "We'll see that a way to evacuate them comes out." Bagchi added that over 22,500 Indians have been evacuated from Ukraine so far.

121.title: Hindustan Petroleum buys 2 million barrels of Russian crude oil: Report
121.article_body: The Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd has bought two million barrels of Russian crude oil, PTI reported on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) bought 3 million barrels of crude oil from Russia at a steep discount. IOC reportedly bought Urals crude for May delivery at a discount of $20-25 a barrel to dated Brent.

122.title: Punjab Kings launch their new jersey, share pic
122.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) have launched their new jersey ahead of the upcoming season of IPL. PBKS have not made many changes to their jersey and have retained their red and golden colours. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26, while PBKS will face RCB in their opener on March 27. PBKS had finished sixth in IPL 2021.

123.title: Lithuanian Parliament urges UN to impose no-fly zone over Ukraine
123.article_body: Lithuanian Parliament has unanimously adopted a resolution urging the UN to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine amid Russian invasion. "The...no-fly zone would...ensure the security of humanitarian corridors," the resolution read. Additionally, it called for democratic countries to impose more sanctions on Russia and Belarus and an expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine, reports stated.

124.title: SP fields doctor Kafeel Khan for UP Legislative Council polls
124.article_body: Samajwadi Party has fielded Gorakhpur paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan for upcoming Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls from Deoria-Kushinagar seat. The paediatrician at Gorakhpur's Baba Raghav Das (BRD) medical college was terminated from service by UP government last year. He was among the accused in the 2017 hospital tragedy in which over 60 children died due to disruption in oxygen supply.

125.title: 'Our soil not fit to run bullet train,' says Nusrat; Minister calls remark 'shameful'
125.article_body: During her speech in Parliament, actress-turned-politician Nusrat Jahan said Indian soil wasn't fit to run bullet trains. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw called her claim "shameful" and said, "We should have full faith in our engineers and our capabilities." The TMC MP later tweeted, "It's the Science...not to be taken as one speech of a street corner meeting."

126.title: Nauman Ali's 18-ball 0* more crucial than my 104*: Muhammad Rizwan
126.article_body: Pakistan batter Muhammad Rizwan said spinner Nauman Ali's unbeaten 0 off 18 balls in the second innings of Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia was more crucial than his 104*. "His compact batting gave me confidence," added Rizwan. "When [Nathan] Lyon came to bowl...I thought only about survival. By God's grace I got...boundaries and got to a hundred," added Rizwan.

127.title: 60 passengers escape unhurt after bus catches fire in MP's Betul
127.article_body: Nearly 60 passengers on board a bus in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district escaped unhurt after it caught fire on Wednesday night. The Hyderabad-bound bus caught ablaze on a national highway, after which the passengers deboarded the vehicle and a fire tanker was called to douse the flames, police added. A probe is underway to ascertain the cause of the fire.

128.title: We are very disappointed with India's stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UK minister
128.article_body: Britain is very disappointed with India's stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, UK's Trade Minister Anne-Marie Trevelyan said. Asked if India's stance would impact trade talks with Britain, Trevelyan said, "We're very disappointed, but we continue to work with Indian partners and hope that their views will change." "India is an incredibly important trading partner for the UK," she added.

129.title: Ellen DeGeneres to give staff more than ₹15 crore in bonuses
129.article_body: American television host Ellen DeGeneres will reportedly pay her staff more than ₹15 crore in bonuses, with the final episode of her talk show 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show' set to air on May 26. Ellen had announced in May 2021 that her talk show would end in 2022, having run for 19 seasons. "It's...not a challenge anymore," Ellen had said.

130.title: I think Kapil Sibal should be expelled: Cong leader TS Singh Deo
130.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister and Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Thursday said former MP Kapil Sibal should be expelled from Congress and that he should form his own party. This comes after Sibal said that the Gandhi family should step down and let others lead Congress. "I think tolerance is the reason for the weakness of Congress party," Singh said.

131.title: Won't take pension as ex-MLA, use it for people's welfare: Parkash Badal
131.article_body: Former Punjab CM and SAD patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has decided to not take the pension as a former MLA and asked the Punjab government to use it for the welfare of the people of Punjab. "Formal request in writing being sent separately," he said. A five-time Punjab CM, Badal lost his first Assembly election since 1969 from Lambi.

132.title: WhatsApp scam uses fake download links of 'The Kashmir Files', people lose ₹30 lakh
132.article_body: Cybercriminals are sending fake movie download links of 'The Kashmir Files' to WhatsApp users to scam them, police have warned. Malware is installed on the users' phones when they click the fake link and it steals the users' bank details, the TOI reported. A Noida police official said three people approached the police with similar complaints after losing ₹30 lakh.

133.title: Have no info right now: MEA on Chinese foreign minister's India visit
133.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Thursday he has no information at the moment about Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi's visit to India. The clarification came amid reports that Yi could visit India later this month. If he arrives in India, it would mark the first visit by a senior Chinese leader amid Indo-China tensions.

134.title: Kim Kardashian says boyfriend Pete got her name branded on his chest
134.article_body: Kim Kardashian has revealed that her boyfriend Pete Davidson got her name branded on his chest. "Pete got this because he wanted to do something different. He wanted to get something...he cannot get removed or cover-up," she stated. "The [other tattoos] are cutesy ones. My favourite one...says 'My girl is a lawyer' and that one is really cute," Kim added.

135.title: People thought 7 is my lucky no., I chose it as it's my date of birth: MSD on jersey no.
135.article_body: Talking about his jersey number seven in a recent interaction, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "A lot of people initially thought 7 is my lucky number and all of that." He added, "But I chose it for a very simple reason. I was born on July 7. So it's the seventh day of the seventh month, that was the reason."

136.title: Russia's Sputnik V vaccine review delayed by WHO over Ukraine war
136.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday said it has delayed the review of Russia's COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V over the country's invasion of Ukraine. "We were supposed to go do inspections in Russia on March 7, and these inspections were postponed for a later date," WHO Assistant Director-General for Access to Medicines and Health Products Mariangela Simao said.

137.title: Help came too late: Ukraine's Zelenskyy in address to German MPs
137.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday virtually addressed the German parliament for the first time, saying that "help came too late to stop war", following Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. "You're still protecting yourself behind a wall that does not make it possible for you to see what we are going through," he added.

138.title: US to give Switchblade drones to Ukraine to target Russian military
138.article_body: US administration will provide Switchblade drones as part of a military aid package to Ukraine for fighting Russia. The military officials described Switchblade drones as 'kamikaze drones" as they can be flown directly at a target and explodes after hitting the target, a report stated. Reportedly, the US secretly sent these drones to Afghanistan in 2010 for use against Taliban.

139.title: Ireland PM Martin tests positive for COVID-19 during US visit
139.article_body: A senior administration official on Wednesday said Ireland's Prime Minister Michéal Martin learned he tested positive for COVID-19 while attending an event with US leaders that included President Joe Biden. Martin was attending the Ireland Funds 30th National Gala in Washington ahead of planned St. Patrick's Day celebrations on Thursday.

140.title: UK among 6 nations to request UN Security Council meeting on Ukraine
140.article_body: The UK permanent mission to the UN on Wednesday said six nations - the UK, US, France, Albania, Ireland and Norway - have requested a meeting of the UN Security Council on the situation in Ukraine. "Russia is committing war crimes and targeting civilians. Russia's illegal war on Ukraine is a threat to us all," the UK mission said.

141.title: Man teaches helmet's role using watermelon, Hyd Police shares video
141.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday shared a video to spread awareness about the role of helmets. In the video, a man can be seen teaching his son the importance of wearing a helmet while riding a two-wheeler with an example of a watermelon. "Wear a helmet when riding a two-wheeler," the police captioned the video.

142.title: Taxi driver sets himself on fire in UP alleging police harassment
142.article_body: A 26-year-old taxi driver set himself on fire inside the Kotawali Gauriphanta police station campus in Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, alleging he was harassed by the police and four other men. According to the police, the victim alleged that the four men and the police used to extort money from taxi drivers. The victim suffered over 80% burn injuries.

143.title: Car thief who messaged police 'catch me if you can' held in B'luru
143.article_body: A man who allegedly stole over 40 cars across at least nine different states was arrested in Bengaluru. Rajasthan-based Satyendra Singh Shekhawat, who allegedly stole luxury cars and SUVs by using smart gadgets to generate duplicate keys, had challenged police by saying, "catch me if you can." The 41-year-old MBA degree holder was also arrested in 2003.

144.title: We encourage Indian leaders to work closely with us to stand up against Putin: US
144.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Thursday said, "We remain in touch...with leaders in India and continue to encourage leaders to work closely with us to stand up against President Putin's invasion of Ukraine." This comes as US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" and offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine.

145.title: Recognise Putin as war criminal: Ukraine minister to EU lawmakers
145.article_body: Ukrainian Minister Oleksii Reznikov has asked European Union (EU) lawmakers to recognise Russian President Vladimir Putin as a war criminal. Reznikov, in his appeal, mentioned Russian bomb shelling on a theatre in Mariupol on Wednesday, which was sheltering over 1,000 people. Notably, US President Joe Biden has called Putin a war criminal, which Kremlin termed "unforgivable".

146.title: PM Modi speaks to South Korea's President-elect, vows to deepen ties
146.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday spoke to South Korean President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol and congratulated him on his victory in the recently held Presidential elections. PM Modi said, "It was a pleasure to speak with...Yoon Suk-yeol. We discussed the potential of further deepening the India-Korea Special Strategic Partnership in many areas." The South Korean Presidential elections were held on March 9.

147.title: Delhi Police details plan to ensure safe Holi, Shab-e-Barat
147.article_body: Delhi's DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan on Thursday said 17 pickets have been placed on roads heading towards New Delhi to ensure intense checking on Holi and Shab-e-Barat. "We've...kept two drones with night vision to keep an eye in the Jama Masjid and Delhi Gate areas," Chauhan said. "Sufficient forces will be deployed. We'll also deploy outside forces," she added.

148.title: Decide on inclusion of Rajbhar community in ST list: HC to UP govt
148.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has asked the Uttar Pradesh government to decide within two months on the inclusion of the Bhar/Rajbhar community in the list of Scheduled Tribes. At present, the community has been given the status of OBC. The court gave the order on a writ petition filed by the Jago Rajbhar Jago Samiti and another on March 11.

149.title: Was truly pampered: Mrunal on working with Ishaan, Priyanshu in Pippa
149.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, speaking about working with Ishaan Khatter and Priyanshu Painyuli in her upcoming film 'Pippa', has said that working on the film felt like she was around her family. Mrunal added that she was "truly pampered" on the set. "These bonds have surely been formed for life. I hope that reflects on screen," she further said.

150.title: Ukrainian mother of 12 killed on front line of war with Russia
150.article_body: Olga Semidyanova, a 48-year-old combat medic, was killed in battle with Russian Armed Force on the front line of war. Olga had been a military medic since 2014 in the Donetsk region. "Olga Semidyanova was awarded the Mother-Heroine status as a mother of six children and six more adopted," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

151.title: Man seeks ₹3 cr in bitcoins for Nawab Malik's release, case filed
151.article_body: Maharashtra minister and senior NCP leader Nawab Malik's son Aamir Malik has lodged an FIR with Mumbai Police after a man allegedly demanded ₹3 crore in bitcoins to get his father out on bail. The accused had sent an email to him. "I've lodged the FIR, but can't share more about it as it is a confidential matter," he said.

152.title: Police sends drone to hunt down history-sheeter hiding in pond in Tamil Nadu
152.article_body: The Tenkasi District Police in Tamil Nadu sent a drone to hunt down a history-sheeter who went into hiding in a pond after assaulting the public. The police drone spotted history-sheeter Shahul Hameed hiding in the marshy water. After the drone spotted him, the police surrounded him from all sides and subsequently arrested him.

153.title: He's an absolute legend: Ranveer on father-in-law Prakash Padukone
153.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his father-in-law Prakash Padukone puts on a show when the latter picks up a badminton racquet. "He'll stand in one place and make you run the entire court," Ranveer added. The actor further said that Prakash has got almost saint-like energy. "He's an absolute legend...I...treasure all the life lessons...he teaches us," Ranveer stated.

154.title: PMC to install 11 sewage treatment plants to clean Mula-Mutha River
154.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to increase its sewage treatment facility to treat domestic sewage discharged in the Mula-Mutha River. The civic body plans to install 11 sewage treatment plants to bridge a treatment gap of over 200 MLD. It aims to improve the water quality and ecology by ensuring no untreated sewage water is released into the river.

155.title: NATO starts military drills in Norway amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
155.article_body: NATO has started "massive" military drills in Norway amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Around 30,000 troops, 220 aircraft and 50 vessels from 27 countries are participating in NATO's "Cold Response" 2022 drills. Meanwhile, an official from the Norwegian Joint Headquarters said the military drills were planned months in advance and is in no way linked to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

156.title: Delhi Police appoints 82 legal consultants to improve probe
156.article_body: Delhi Police said that they have hired 82 legal consultants across different districts and in units like the crime branch and special cell to assist investigating officers and to improve the quality of the probe. Officials on Thursday said that the consultants will improve investigation in important cases, help in registering FIRs efficiently and help in training new recruits.

157.title: Honduran judge grants US' extradition request for ex-Prez Hernández
157.article_body: A Honduran judge on Wednesday authorised the extradition of ex-President Juan Orlando Hernández to the US to face drug trafficking and weapons charges. "We're going to file an appeal to try to avoid extradition," Hernández's lawyer said. Hernández, who was arrested last month, has been accused of being involved in a narco-trafficking scheme, accepting bribes and abetting use of weapons.

158.title: Paytm's target price slashed to ₹450 by Macquarie citing 'tough times ahead'
158.article_body: Macquarie has cut its target price for Paytm's parent company One97 Communications Ltd shares by about 36%, to ₹450 apiece, as it sees "tough times ahead" for the company. "With the RBI raising issues with Paytm Payments Bank and Chinese ownership being over 25%, the probability of Paytm getting a small finance banking licence is significantly lower now," Macquarie said.

159.title: Zero COVID-19 patients in Delhi's LNJP Hospital for 1st time in 2yrs
159.article_body: Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital on Thursday saw zero COVID-19 admissions for the first time since March 2020, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. LNJP Hospital Medical Director Dr Suresh Kumar said the last two COVID-19 patients were discharged on Wednesday. "Salute to the entire medical fraternity for their dedicated service," Jain added.

160.title: Delhi Police arrest 11 under 'Operation Hifazat' to curb street crime
160.article_body: The South District Police on Tuesday arrested 11 suspects in six different cases under 'Operation Hifazat', which has been launched to curb street crime in Delhi, senior officers said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (south) Benita Mary Jaikar said in six separate operations, two bootleggers, seven gamblers and two criminals carrying illegal knives were arrested.

161.title: 5 of DDA's 6 new sports facilities to be in Dwarka
161.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is developing six sports facilities in Delhi, of which five will be located in Dwarka, including a golf course. The complexes will be located in sectors 17, 8, 19, 23 and 24, where the golf course is proposed. The construction of the ₹45-crore golf course is almost 26% complete, a senior DDA official said.

162.title: Sandeepa posts old home's pic after watching Kashmir Files, says 'family escaped in truck'
162.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files', actress Sandeepa Dhar wrote, "The day they announced Kashmiri Pandits should leave their women behind and leave Kashmir, my family [fled] their homeland, hidden in...truck." She added her family is experiencing PTSD from having to relive it and thanked Vivek Agnihotri for "showing the truth". Sandeepa also shared a picture of their old home.

163.title: BMW modified, fitted with machine gun by Ukrainians to fight Russia; video viral
163.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, a video of a modified BMW 6 Series car with a heavy machine gun mounted on it in Ukraine has gone viral on social media. The weapon mounted in the car's trunk is Soviet-era NSV 12.7X108mm, according to reports. The video shows the car painted in the colours of Ukrainian flag.

164.title: Bhupinder Hooda meets Rahul, day after attending rebel leaders' meet
164.article_body: Former Haryana CM and senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Thursday met former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, claimed reports. A day earlier, Hooda had attended the meeting of rebel leaders of Congress, to discuss the party's situation after the poor performance in polls. Reportedly, Hooda visited senior party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad after meeting Gandhi.

165.title: Many people in Russia are showing themselves to be traitors: Kremlin
165.article_body: Many people in Russia were showing themselves to be "traitors", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday, pointing at those "leaving their jobs" and "moving to other countries". His comments came a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia is undergoing a "natural and necessary self-cleansing" as people were able to "distinguish the true patriots from the scum and...traitors".

166.title: Thanks Shahid for making these 6 months fun: Ali post wrapping shoot
166.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that the shooting of his upcoming film, which features actor Shahid Kapoor, has been completed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Thank you, Shahid, and the entire team for making these last six months super fun." The untitled film is reportedly an adaptation of a French action thriller, 'Nuit Blanche'.

167.title: Taiwan to launch locally made satellites in 2026: Minister
167.article_body: Taiwanese Science and Technology Minister Wu Tsung-tsong has said the country could launch locally made satellites from its territory in 2026, a report stated. Tsung-tsong said he hoped the construction of the satellite's base could start in 2024 and by 2025, it would be completed, the report added. The ministry is reportedly looking for a site for the satellites' launch.

168.title: Meta to allow parents to track their kids' Instagram time globally
168.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta will allow parents to track how much time their children are spending on Instagram globally soon. The Instagram supervision tools will roll out globally over the coming months, Meta said. Parents will also be able to see what accounts their children follow and set time limits for their kids to spend on the app.

169.title: Remove real culprit or Cong will be haunted in 2024 and beyond: Sunil Jakhar
169.article_body: Days after Congress chief Sonia Gandhi sacked party chiefs of five states including Punjab, senior leader Sunil Jakhar said, "A sham 'witch-hunt' will not help. Show courage. Censure and remove the real culprit from high positions." "Otherwise, this ghost of religion/caste/identity politics will haunt the Congress party in Punjab even in 2024 and beyond," he added.

170.title: India's 1st vaccine to protect lions against CDV in clinical trial stage
170.article_body: The clinical trials for India's first indigenously-produced vaccine against Canine Distemper Virus (CDV) have begun. The vaccine, developed by Gujarat Biotechnology and Research Centre (GBRC), has shown over 80% efficacy according to initial results, a state government official said. The virus is reported to have killed 30 lions at Gir National Park in Gujarat in 2018.

171.title: India managed Omicron surge much better than other countries: Centre
171.article_body: India's COVID-19 vaccination drive helped the nation to manage Omicron surge better than other countries, Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. "Today...15-17 lakh cases are being reported globally but India is reporting around 3000 daily cases," he said. India has administered over 180 crore vaccine doses which is 3.2 times more than US, he added.

172.title: 2 men from Bihar arrested in Mumbai for possessing charas worth ₹1 cr
172.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested in Mumbai for possessing 3 kg of charas worth ₹1 crore. The accused were arrested on Tuesday in Goregaon (east) when they had arrived to deliver the contraband, an official said. "During the probe, it was found that the accused were involved in supplying contraband in different parts of...country," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

173.title: Govt orders aggressive genome sequencing as COVID cases rise in Asia, Europe: Report
173.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed officials to aggressively carry out genomic sequencing as COVID-19 cases are rising again in some Asian and European countries, reports said. The two-hour-long meeting was attended by the head of India's COVID-19 task force Dr VK Paul, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria and ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava among other people, reports added.
