174.title: Crypto produces 17 'known' billionaires worldwide: Hurun Rich List 2022
174.article_body: Cryptocurrency has produced 17 "known" billionaires worldwide, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. The pack of 17 billionaires is led by Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance. He's followed by Bahamian cryptocurrency exchange FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase, is the world's third-richest crypto billionaire.

175.title: Vaccination drive a testament to India's capabilities: Mansukh Mandaviya
175.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya said India's vaccination drive that produced affordable vaccines for Indians and exported them to over 150 countries is a testament to India's capabilities. He also thanked health workers, NGOs for working tirelessly throughout the pandemic. "Management of COVID-19 pandemic...has strongly demonstrated to the world the power of...self-reliance," he added.

176.title: Guj govt schools to teach English from Class 1 instead of Class 3
176.article_body: Gujarat government schools will now teach English as a subject from Class 1 instead of Class 3 from the new academic session starting June 2022, state Education Minister Jitu Vaghani announced on Thursday. "Gujarati is mandatory and important but English will be taught to Class 1 and 2 students too," he said. The minister was speaking in the state Assembly.

177.title: Do you support this bloody war, SAP: Ukraine Vice PM on video of Russian attack
177.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted a video showing the destruction in the country amid Russia's attack and wrote, "Do you support this, SAP? Or you can stop your support?" Fedorov alleged, "After 21 days of bloody war, German company SAP continues technically supporting its Russian clients - Gazprom, Sberbank, Rosatom and others." "This money murders Ukrainian children!" he added.

178.title: My son is happy that I'm working: Sonali on judging 'Dance India Dance...'
178.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, who is currently judging the reality show 'Dance India Dance Li'l Masters' season 5, years after being diagnosed with cancer, spoke about her son's reaction to her working after long. She said, "He's very happy that his mother is working and is out of his hair now. He'd be saying that 'it's good that mom is busy'."

179.title: I'm really excited: Viay on working with Kareena in Sujoy Ghosh's next
179.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who recently announced a new project with Sujoy Ghosh, said he's really excited to share screen space with actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat. He added, "I had been waiting to tell the world about it." "Not only is the script so amazing but also the kind of team [I'm getting] to work with," Vijay said.

180.title: Instagram bans Kanye for 24 hrs over racial post against Trevor Noah
180.article_body: Instagram has banned US rapper Kanye West for 24 hours for violating its policies on hate speech, bullying and harassment. Kanye had directed a racial post at talk show host Trevor Noah after he said Kanye was harassing his former wife Kim Kardashian. The rapper responded by replacing some of 'Kumbaya' song lyrics with a racial slur against Black people.

181.title: Over 19 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
181.article_body: More than 19,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Thursday. Around 60,000 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Wednesday alone, it added. According to the UN refugee agency, more than 30 lakh people have now fled Ukraine to escape the war.

182.title: Reform, perform, transform to next level: PM to trainee civil servants
182.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed the valedictory function of the 96th Common Foundation Course at Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration, Mussoorie. Speaking to the IAS trainees, he urged them to focus on the "biggest goal of the 21st century" Atmanirbhar Bharat and Modern India. He further asked them to "reform, perform and transform to the next level".

183.title: I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up opposition: Pakistan minister
183.article_body: As Pakistan PM Imran Khan faces no-confidence motion, Pakistan Minister Ghulam Sarwar Khan said, "Although suicide bombing is forbidden, I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up the entire opposition." Voting on the no-confidence motion is slated to take place between March 26 and 30, with Imran Khan saying the opposition's motion is going to fail.

184.title: Majority of people say they thought I would be like a sexbot: Bella Hadid
184.article_body: American model Bella Hadid said, "The majority of the time when I meet people, they say, 'I...didn't think you...[would] be nice, that you were going to be...some kind of a sexbot." "For three years while I was working, I would wake up...hysterical, in tears alone," added Bella. "I was on this calorie-counting app which was like the devil," stated Bella.

185.title: Pankaj denies doing Pawan Kalyan's film, says 'Hope to work with him soon'
185.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi dismissed the reports that he will be a part of Pawan Kalyan's film 'Bhavadeeyudu Bhagat Singh'. He said, "Reading the news of doing a film with Pawan Kalyan on social media made me really happy...But as much as I want this news to be true, unfortunately, it's not. But I...hope I get to work with him someday."

186.title: Speechless, moved to tears: Zoe Saldana on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2'
186.article_body: Sharing her experience on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2' which is the sequel to 2009 film 'Avatar', actress Zoe Saldana who starred in the original film said, "I was speechless. I was moved to tears." "I can get choked up just talking about it," added Saldana. 'Avatar' is among the highest-grossing movies of all time.

187.title: RR have got the 2 best spinners in IPL in Ashwin, Chahal: Sangakkara
187.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the franchise have got the two best spinners in the IPL in Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "We have secured depth in every department," added Sangakkara. Ashwin has taken 145 wickets in 167 IPL matches with Chahal picking 139 wickets in 114 matches.

188.title: BJP leader Pravin Darekar granted protection from arrest till Mar 21
188.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Legislative Council Leader of Opposition Pravin Darekar has been granted protection from arrest by a Mumbai court till March 21. Darekar's anticipatory bail plea will be heard on March 21. He had filed the bail application regarding an FIR registered against him for fraudulently contesting a cooperative bank election in the 'labour' category.

189.title: Robot-assisted surgery in Delhi helps man shed diapers after 24 yrs
189.article_body: A 24-year-old Yemenese man suffering from a congenital defect called Extropy Epispadias Complex was operated in a robot-assisted surgery in Delhi which has enabled him to shed diapers he was using for 24 years. In this condition, the lower abdominal wall does not develop at all, leaving the bladder open with urine draining out from the open abdomen, doctors said.

190.title: Twitter account of Statistics Ministry briefly hacked, name changed to Elon Musk
190.article_body: The official Twitter handle of the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation briefly appeared to be hacked on Thursday. Hackers changed the account's display name to Elon Musk and display photo to that of the Tesla CEO and posted several tweets on Musk's timeline. This comes months after Information and Broadcasting Ministry's Twitter account was hacked.

191.title: Taiwan inseparable part of China, don’t equate it with Ukraine: Chinese envoy
191.article_body: Chinese ambassador to the United States Qin Gang called against equating Taiwan with Ukraine, saying that while the latter is a sovereign state, the former is an inseparable part of China's territory. "We hope the United States earnestly abides by the one-China principle and does not support 'Taiwan independence' separatism in any form," he added.

192.title: Kejriwal gives govt job to brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots
192.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday gave an appointment letter for a government job to Ankur Sharma, the brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma who was killed in the 2020 Delhi riots. Ankur has been posted in the Education Department of the Delhi Government. "We can't compensate for...loss of a loved one...[but] this...job...will be of immense help," Kejriwal tweeted.

193.title: Sceptics wondering ‘Even that's possible': 'Gangubai...' producer on its success
193.article_body: Jayantilal Gada, who is one of the producers of Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' said, "People didn't expect much from the film. Now that the [film's]...successful, the sceptics are...wondering, 'Ok, even that's possible'." Gada is also one of the producers of the upcoming film 'RRR', which stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR. "The film will generate...greater...craze than 'Baahubali'," added Gada.

194.title: The Hundred draft postponed to avoid clash with Shane Warne's state funeral
194.article_body: The draft for the second edition of 'The Hundred' has been rescheduled to avoid a clash with the state funeral of Shane Warne, who passed away on March 4 after a heart attack. The draft, originally scheduled on March 29, will now be held on April 5. Warne will be given a public farewell at MCG on March 30.

195.title: 519 fishermen from Gujarat imprisoned in Pakistani jails: Minister
195.article_body: As many as 519 fishermen from Gujarat were imprisoned in jails in Pakistan till December 2021, Minister of State for Fisheries Jitubhai Chaudhari said. Pakistani authorities apprehended 163 and 195 fishermen in 2020 and 2021 respectively. As many as 247 fishermen are in Pakistani jails for one year, 76 for three years and one for over five years, Chaudhari added.

196.title: Ukraine claims 14,000 Russian soldiers killed; 444 enemy tanks destroyed
196.article_body: Ukraine on Thursday claimed that it has killed around 14,000 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. It further estimated that 444 Russian tanks, more than 190 aircraft have been destroyed by their military. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1435 armoured personnel carriers, 201 artillery systems, and 72 multiple launch rocket systems.

197.title: Russia rejects UN court's order to immediately stop Ukraine invasion
197.article_body: Kremlin has rejected the order to immediately stop the invasion of Ukraine by United Nations' top court, International Court of Justice. "We cannot take this decision into account," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. He added that both parties, Russia and Ukraine, had to agree for the ruling to be implemented. "No consent can be obtained in this case," Peskov said.

198.title: Consumers could lose invested money if they buy crypto assets: EU
198.article_body: The European Union's securities, banking and insurance watchdogs in a joint statement warned that consumers risk losing all their money invested in cryptocurrency assets and could fall prey to scams. "Consumers should be alert to the risks of misleading advertisements, including via social media and influencers," the authorities said. They also mentioned energy consumption by some assets.

199.title: Experiencing PTSD, family left Kashmir with sister hidden under seat: Sandeepa
199.article_body: Actress Sandeepa Dhar took to social media to share that 'The Kashmir Files' has made her family experience PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder). "My family decided to flee their homeland...hidden in back of truck...with my young cousin sister hidden under seat behind my father's feet for safety," she said, adding that the film is a "punch in the gut" for her.

200.title: Man gets 20 years in jail for planting bomb at K'taka's Mangaluru airport
200.article_body: A court on Wednesday sentenced a man to 20 years in jail under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act for planting a bomb near the departure gate of Karnataka's Mangaluru International Airport. An unattended bag was found near the gate on January 20, 2020, which was later defused by a bomb squad. Mangaluru Police had filed the charge-sheet in June 2020.

201.title: 175 terrorists killed, 183 captured in last 1 year in J&K: CRPF chief
201.article_body: Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) DG Kuldiep Singh said the paramilitary force killed 175 terrorists and captured 183 in Jammu and Kashmir since March 1, 2021. He added that 1,500 terrorists and Maoists were arrested and 750 others were forced to surrender in 2021-22. With 246 battalions and over 3.15 lakh personnel, CRPF is world's largest paramilitary force, Singh said.

202.title: Pic shows tumbler removed from woman's bladder in Tunisia; was used for 'erotic purpose'
202.article_body: Doctors removed a glass tumbler from a woman's bladder in Tunisia after she went to them complaining of urinary tract infection (UTI). A scan of the woman's bladder had revealed a large bladder stone with a glass encased. "The patient disclosed this happened while she was using an intra-vaginal foreign body (glass) for erotic purposes 4 years ago," doctors said.

203.title: AAP moves SC against postponement of Delhi civic polls, seeks orders for SEC
203.article_body: AAP has approached SC seeking directions for the state Election Commission to conduct municipal elections in Delhi in a free, fair and expeditious manner without the interference from Centre. The plea was filed after the commission deferred polls as the Centre planned to merge three municipalities of Delhi. AAP claimed Centre was attempting to buckle the state Election Commission's independence.

204.title: 6 Japanese doctors reach Hungary to treat refugees from Ukraine
204.article_body: A team of six Japanese doctors and other medical professionals has arrived in Hungary to assist refugees from Ukraine and provide them with aid. The professionals, who are working with Hungarian doctors in border town of Zahony, are reportedly associated with non-governmental bodies in Japan. Ukrainians are facing many hardships, we want to provide them support, a Japanese medic said.

205.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police shares video of man hit by bike on busy road
205.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Thursday posted a video of a road accident in the city. The video shows a man on a bike being hit by another bike on a busy road, following which the traffic police comes to their rescue. "Who is at fault?" police captioned the video. It often posts such videos to spread awareness on road safety.

206.title: Punjab CM announces anti-corruption helpline; complaints to be lodged via WhatsApp
206.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has announced that an anti-corruption helpline will be launched on freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's Shaheedi Diwas on March 23. People of the state will be able to lodge complaints regarding corruption via WhatsApp. Earlier in the day, Mann said, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab."

207.title: Ukraine says Qualcomm inadvertently aiding Russia, firm calls it 'incorrect'
207.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov urged Qualcomm to end its operations and supplies in Russia, adding, Qualcomm products are "inadvertently" enabling Russia to kill Ukrainians. Qualcomm's Senior VP Nate Tibbits said the firm is complying with US sanctions and is not selling products to Russian companies. "Qualcomm has called for peaceful resolution to the aggression," Tibbits said.

208.title: B'luru Police launches helmet campaign in memory of Puneeth Rajkumar
208.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has launched a campaign in honour of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar to raise awareness about the role of high-quality helmets in saving lives. Puneeth's wife, Ashwini Puneeth Rajkumar, inaugurated the campaign and distributed helmets to women traffic personnel. A video, which showed Puneeth urging people to follow traffic rules and wear helmets, was also released by police.

209.title: Loan sharks blackmail woman with morphed image in Mumbai, case filed
209.article_body: An FIR has been lodged at Mumbai's Parksite police station after a 39-year-old woman claimed that loan sharks allegedly blackmailed her saying they would upload her morphed obscene picture if she doesn't repay the loan. She had repaid ₹8,000 in February but the accused kept demanding more money. Later, she received a WhatsApp message carrying her morphed image.

210.title: Heat wave to severe heat wave warning issued for 9 states/UTs over 2 days, list released
210.article_body: IMD issued heat wave to severe heat wave warning for nine states and UTs over two days. Heat wave to severe heat wave conditions are very likely to prevail in parts of Rajasthan and Gujarat on March 17 and 18. Further, heat wave conditions are likely over Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Jammu & Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh.

211.title: Stunning: Twinkle as Asha Parekh features on cover of Harper's Bazaar magazine
211.article_body: Akshay Kumar's wife, author Twinkle Khanna reacted as veteran actress Asha Parekh featured on the cover of Harper's Bazaar India magazine. Taking to Instagram, Twinkle wrote, "How stunning is this picture! Asha Ji is magnificent." In the picture, Asha is seen donning a black pullover with a statement pearl necklace.

212.title: The only question is match readiness of Dhoni, Rayudu, Uthappa: Irfan
212.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said the only question for CSK ahead of the upcoming IPL season is the match readiness of MS Dhoni, Ambati Rayudu and Robin Uthappa. "CSK picked players [in the auction] from their champion team of 2021...who are match-winners on their own," added Irfan. CSK will face KKR in IPL's opener on March 26.

213.title: Delhi Metro services delayed on 3 lines; office-goers affected
213.article_body: Services on Delhi Metro's Violet, Pink and Green lines were delayed on Thursday morning, affecting office-goers. An official said the delay was due to a technical snag and it was resolved later. Commuters took to Twitter to comment on the delay. A passenger said, "You heard about work from home and work from office...now you can see work from metro."

214.title: Maharashtra govt imposing restrictions on Hindu festivals: BJP MLA
214.article_body: Maharashtra government is imposing restrictions on Hindu festivals, BJP MLA Ram Kadam said. This comes after the Maha Vikas Aghadi government announced restrictions ahead of Holi. "Why is MVA resorting to such extreme steps?" Kadam added. Maharashtra government announced guidelines for Holi mandating celebrations should end by 10 pm and banned the use of loudspeakers.

215.title: Who are the world's 10 richest people & what are their net worths as per Hurun?
215.article_body: Tesla's Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $205 billion wealth, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. He's followed by Jeff Bezos with $188 billion wealth and LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault with $153 billion wealth. Bill Gates is the 4th richest person and he's followed by Warren Buffett and Google Co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page.

216.title: Extra step non-striker takes might end up destroying your career: Ashwin to bowlers
216.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, in a message for bowlers regarding 'mankading' dismissal being shifted from 'unfair play' to 'run-out' section in MCC rule book, urged bowlers to not have "second thoughts" on running non-strikers out. He added, "Extra step the non-striker is taking might end up destroying your...career. If...non-striker ends up on strike because of that extra step...he might smash a six."

217.title: 4 family members of ex-village pradhan killed over land dispute in UP
217.article_body: Four family members of a former pradhan at Rajapur Gungawachh village in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi district were killed over a land dispute which was going on for a long time with a relative. Four persons have been arrested in connection with the alleged murder, police said. The pradhan had dumped building materials on the disputed land, police added.

218.title: We have the power to put all of our brash enemies in their place: Russia
218.article_body: Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, has said that country has the power to put "all of its brash enemies in their place". Medvedev, who served as President from 2008 to 2012, added that the US had stoked "disgusting" Russophobia in an attempt to force Russia on its knees and then rip it apart.

219.title: Kohli said 'You may be talking to wrong person': Karthik on request to consider him for RCB
219.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik recalled his chat with Virat Kohli last year, revealing that he had "slipped in" a request to consider him for RCB in the mega auction. "I slipped it into him and he said, 'You might be talking to the wrong person, bro!'" Karthik added. Karthik was bought by RCB for ₹5.5 crore.

220.title: UAE cargo ship with 30 crew members including Indians sinks, 28 rescued so far
220.article_body: A United Arab Emirates cargo ship sank off the coast of Iran with 30 crew members including Indians aboard, authorities said. Rescuers saved 16 crew members, the captain said. Another 11 had made it onto a life raft, while one person was saved by a nearby tanker. Two crew members were still in the water, he added.

221.title: Sensex ends 1,047 points higher at 57,864, logs best week in over a year
221.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,047 points on Thursday to close at 57,864 following gains in global markets, a day after US Federal Reserve's first interest rate hike in over three years. The Nifty 50 jumped 312 points to end at 17,287. HDFC and Reliance Industries were among top gainers. The Sensex and Nifty logged their best week in over a year.

222.title: PM's pic on 'The Kashmir..' tickets will spread hate faster: Minority body
222.article_body: Dr J Aslam Basha, Chairman of the Minority Department Tamil Nadu Congress Committee, took to Twitter to say that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should pass a law to print his picture on tickets of 'The Kashmir Files'. "The hate will spread much faster," his tweet added. PM Modi had earlier said campaign is being run to discredit the film.

223.title: Bringing outside shoes inside home is health hazard: Scientists
223.article_body: Wearing shoes in the house is just plain gross and a potential health hazard, scientists who study indoor contaminants have warned. Some of the microorganisms present on shoe bottoms are drug-resistant pathogens that are very difficult to treat. Moreover, they also consist of cancer-causing toxins from asphalt residue on roads as well as endocrine-disrupting lawn chemicals, the researchers found.

224.title: Reliance, Ola Electric win bids under ₹18,100 cr PLI scheme: Reports
224.article_body: Reliance Industries and Ola Electric will receive incentives under Centre's ₹18,100 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to boost local battery cell production, Reuters reported. Hyundai Motors and Indian jewellery maker Rajesh Exports have also won the bids. Ola Electric and Hyundai will get incentives for 20 Gwh capacity while Reliance and Rajesh Exports have won incentives for 5 Gwh.

225.title: 119 batteries worth ₹6.7 lakh stolen from Pune godown
225.article_body: Pune Police have registered a case against an unknown person for stealing 119 batteries worth ₹6.7 lakh from a godown in city's Khadki area. The batteries were reportedly stored inside a barbed compound, however, the accused managed to enter the premises and steal them. "We have leads and will soon arrest people...These are batteries used in broadband modems,” police said.

226.title: 'Doesn't he own a suit?' says US millionaire on Zelenskyy's speech outfit; criticised
226.article_body: US millionaire and financier Peter Schiff criticised Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's outfit for virtual address to US Congress. "I understand times are hard, but doesn't the President of the Ukraine own a suit...I wouldn't want to disrespect the institution or the United States," he tweeted. Schiff was widely criticised for his remarks, with a user calling it the "dumbest thing".

227.title: 188 cases of custodial death in Gujarat in 2 years: CM Bhupendra Patel
227.article_body: As many as 188 cases of custodial death were reported in Gujarat in the last two years, the state government said in response to a question raised by a Congress MLA. CM Bhupendra Patel added that 88 incidents of custodial death took place in 2020 and 100 in 2021. FIRs were lodged and departmental inquiries were initiated, the government stated.

228.title: If I like a singer's song, I buy it: Akshay on being called a mini T-Series
228.article_body: Akshay Kumar spoke about his reputation as 'mini T-Series' in a recent interview ahead of the release of his film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. He said, "Whenever I like a song by a new music director or...singer, I acquire it." "I keep them with me and when it fits in a particular situation in a movie, I use them accordingly," he added.

229.title: Harmanpreet needs to bat higher up in Women's WC: Edulji
229.article_body: Ex-India captain Diana Edulji has suggested Harmanpreet Kaur, who has scored a century and a fifty in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, to bat at number three instead of her usual number five position in upcoming games. "Opening pair (Smriti and Yastika) is fine...Deepti [at number four], and Mithali can control the innings at five," Edulji explained.

230.title: Toyota plans to make 8 lakh vehicles per month amid chip shortage
230.article_body: Toyota is planning to produce an average of 8 lakh vehicles per month globally in the April-June quarter due to the global chip shortage. Earlier, Toyota had announced plans to cut output in Japan by 20% in April, 10% in May and 5% in June. The firm said its production is operating as normal, but won't help recover lost output.

231.title: Shiv Sena MP demands reducing fare of Mumbai AC local trains
231.article_body: While speaking in the Lok Sabha recently, Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale called for reducing the fare of AC local trains in Mumbai. He claimed few passengers travel by AC trains. "As a solution to this, if the Railways reduce the fares of AC locals, then the ridership will increase and there will be no loss," he said.

232.title: Prostitution racket busted in Chennai spa, two held
232.article_body: Chennai police have arrested two men on the charge of running a prostitution racket at a spa in one of the busiest areas of the city. Three women were rescued. According to the police, they received information that a few people were forcing young women, who came to the city in search of jobs, into prostitution.

233.title: Investors ₹19 lakh cr richer as Sensex adds over 5,000 points in 8 sessions
233.article_body: The Sensex added more than 5,000 points and the Nifty50 gained over 1,400 points in the last eight sessions in a row, barring the March 15 trading, making investors ₹19 lakh crore richer, Moneycontrol reported on Thursday. On Thursday itself, investors' wealth increased by ₹4 lakh crore. This comes amid positive global cues, easing commodity prices and declining volatility.

234.title: Russia frees abducted Ukraine mayor in exchange for 9 conscript soldiers
234.article_body: Russian forces freed the Mayor of Ukraine's Melitopol city in exchange for nine of their captured conscript soldiers, a spokeswoman of the head of Ukraine's President's Office said. Russian soldiers exchanged had all been born between 2002-2003, "practically children", Daria Zarivna added. Following the release, Ivan Fedorov thanked Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for "not abandoning" him.

235.title: Priest misbehaves with girl under pretext of counselling in Kerala, held
235.article_body: Police have arrested a 34-year-old priest in Kerala for "misbehaving" with a 17-year-old girl who was taken to his residence for counselling. The next day he went to the girl's house and repeated the behaviour. The girl reportedly told her friend about incident who in turn informed the school authorities. Police said that priest will be produced before a court.

236.title: 3 morning walkers killed, 1 injured after lorry mows them down in Kerala
236.article_body: Three senior citizens, who went for a morning walk, were killed in the Alappuzha district of Kerala on Thursday after being mowed down by a speeding lorry. Another person, who was also with them, suffered critical injuries and was admitted to a nearby hospital, police said. The vehicle and its driver were later taken into custody, police added.

237.title: Shops shut in B'luru as Muslim clerics call for bandh over hijab verdict
237.article_body: A few shops were shut in some areas of Bengaluru after Muslim clerics called for a day-long bandh in Karnataka to protest against the High Court's verdict on hijab. Shop owners reportedly said they would "bear this loss of business for the sake of their rights". Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

238.title: Assam Police recover weapons, warlike stores from passenger bus
238.article_body: The Assam Police on Thursday recovered weapons and warlike stores from a bag in a passenger bus in the Karbi Anglong district of the state. The police along with the troops of Assam Rifles had intercepted the bus near Bokajan. "The owner of the bag had not boarded the bus," Bokajan Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO) said.

239.title: Video shows cobra striking man as he performs stunt, IFS officer says 'Horrific'
239.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda shared a video of a cobra striking a Karnataka man as he performs stunt with three snakes. He can be seen pulling at their tails and moving his hands. "This is just horrific way of handling cobras...The snake considers the movements as threats and follows the movement. At times, the response can be fatal," wrote Nanda.

240.title: Meta removes more Russia posts calling kid's hospital bombing a hoax
240.article_body: Meta's Facebook has removed more official Russian posts that claimed reports of Russia bombing a children's hospital in Ukraine were fake. The misinformation reportedly circulated on Russian Embassy's Twitter, Facebook and Telegram accounts after the platforms took down several posts by the embassy in the UK.

241.title: 10 CRPF personnel died by suicide so far this year, says chief
241.article_body: CRPF DG Kuldiep Singh has said that 10 personnel have died by suicide so far in 2022. "We are taking various steps to address mental stress including organising 'Chaupal' where personnel share their problems and we try to solve them," he said. "If we are unable to solve it, then we take it to the professionals," he added.

242.title: Remove flexes from Pune Metro pillars, punish offenders: BJP leader
242.article_body: BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar has sought the removal of banners and flexes from Pune Metro pillars. "Instead of just removing these flexes and boards, Maha Metro should [also] take legal action...against the wrongdoers,” Khardekar wrote to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Maha Metro rail officials. The Pune Metro Rail commenced its operations on March 6.

243.title: Garbage catches huge fire in Pune, smoke seen from several kilometres
243.article_body: Garbage accumulated in a canal near Pune's Pulgate area caught a huge fire on Wednesday, resulting in dense smoke that was seen from a distance of several kilometres. No person was injured and no damage reported, an officer said. He added that it was a huge fire and it took about half an hour to bring the situation under control.

244.title: School teacher runs away with minor girl student in Odisha; arrested
244.article_body: A private school teacher from Odisha's tribal-district Sundargarh was arrested for allegedly running away with one of his minor students studying in Class 8. According to police, the teacher, who was also the girl's Math tutor, entrapped her into a relationship and eloped with her. He was caught by Kutra police team in Bihar's Siwan district after her father's complaint.

245.title: Moody's slashes India's FY22 GDP growth estimate from 9.5% to 9.1%
245.article_body: Moody's has slashed India's GDP growth estimate for FY22 from 9.5% to 9.1%. According to the rating agency, the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is expected to cost India a high fuel and fertiliser import bill in FY22, leading to reduced government spending and a reduction in India's GDP growth. Moody's has projected India's year-end inflation at 6.6% in FY22.

246.title: Used to be rackets & strings, now this: Ukraine tennis star Alex on pic of gun, army gear
246.article_body: Ukrainian tennis star Alex Dolgopolov has shared a picture of military gear and an assault rifle on Twitter amid war with Russia. "Used to be rackets and strings, now this," he wrote with the picture. "I'm back, to help with what I can and defend our home," he wrote in another tweet.

247.title: DRDO constructs 7-storey building in record 45 days for developing fighter jets
247.article_body: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has constructed a seven-storey FCS Complex in record 45 days in Bengaluru. The building would be used as the R&D facility for the indigenous development of fifth-generation Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA). Defence Minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated the FCS Complex in Bengaluru on Thursday.

248.title: Pakistan's performance was probably best-ever in match-saving cause: Raja
248.article_body: Praising Pakistan for their performance in the second Test against Australia, which ended in a draw, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said their batting was probably the best-ever in a match-saving cause. "Babar Azam probably played the best innings of his life," he added. Babar scored 196 runs while Mohammad Rizwan remained unbeaten at 104 runs in their second innings.

249.title: Species of frog believed to be mute chirps first time in 100 years
249.article_body: Ecuadoran biologist Jorge Brito discovered a toad belonging to the Rhinella festae species chirping in the forest while trekking. The brown frog species characterised by its rough skin and prominent nose was believed to be mute ever since it was discovered 100 years ago. Brito took the toad to a laboratory and found it could sing without a vocal sack.

250.title: Bengaluru student dies by suicide after lecturer rejects his project record
250.article_body: A 20-year-old student from Bengaluru studying hotel management in Mangalore died by suicide allegedly after his lecturer rejected his project record and told him that he would not be allowed to sit for an exam. The student has been identified as B Bharath. In a police complaint, Bharath's father has accused the lecturer and college chairman for his son's death.

251.title: Doglapan chodo: Ashneer to BharatPe board on 'making crores with T20 WC passes' allegation
251.article_body: Ashneer Grover responded to the allegations of making crores of rupees by selling free passes during ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2021, by tweeting, "Board waalo yeh sab Doglapan chodo." He also shared a picture from the tournament, and wrote, "What I am actually doing is ensuring Suhail Sameer (CEO) and Sumeet Singh don't drink silly the hospitality section dry."

252.title: India has world's 3rd highest number of self-made billionaires: Hurun
252.article_body: As per the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, India ranks third in the list of self-made billionaires with 119 such individuals. These individuals have cumulative wealth of $474 billion. China has the most number of self-made billionaires at 1,050, with $3.756 trillion combined wealth, while the US stands second with 523 self-made billionaires, whose combined wealth is $3.554 trillion.

253.title: Ukraine war's impact on fossil fuel prices will boost renewables: German minister
253.article_body: German minister Patrick Graichen has said the impact of Russia-Ukraine war on fossil fuels will boost the means needed to curb climate change. "The core technologies to become independent of (Russian President Vladimir) Putin and to drive forward climate protection are the same," he said. "They are renewables, efficiency and electrification. These will get a massive boost," he added.

254.title: UP ends all COVID-19 curbs, allows weddings at 100% capacity
254.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday released an order, underlining that all COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in the state amid dipping cases. The order said weddings and other events can take place at full capacity of the venue while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. Water parks and swimming pools can reopen and Anganwadi centres can resume functioning, the order read.

255.title: If Putin is afraid to fight, I'll use only my left hand & I'm not left-handed: Musk
255.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to "single combat" amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, tweeted, "If he (Putin) is afraid to fight, I will agree to use only my left hand and I am not even left-handed." Musk tweeted this after Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov told Musk, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's."

256.title: Noida-Greater Noida Metro services to start after 2 pm on Holi
256.article_body: The Noida-Greater Noida Metro services will be available from 2 pm on the occasion of Holi on Friday. The parking facility at Noida Sector-51 station will also be available from 2 pm. "Normally on working days, NMRC metro trains services start from 6 am," Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) Managing Director Ritu Maheshwari said.

257.title: Tennis player who defeated Federer seen carrying Kalashnikov rifle amid Russia attack
257.article_body: Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky who defeated Roger Federer in the second round at Wimbledon in 2013 has taken up arms amid Russia's attack on the country. Stakhovsky was seen patrolling the Maidan Square, armed with a Kalashnikov rifle and a pistol in his belt. "I'm not sure how I am going to react to shooting at somebody," he said.

258.title: Bhagwant Mann unfurls new anti-mafia era in Punjab: Navjot Singh Sidhu
258.article_body: A day after resigning as the Punjab Congress chief, Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said, "Bhagwant Mann unfurls a new anti-mafia era in Punjab with a mountain of expectations." "The happiest man is the one from whom no one expects…hope he rises to the occasion, brings back Punjab on the revival path with pro-people policies…best always," Sidhu tweeted.

259.title: Mahatma Gandhi Green Triangle inaugurated in Madagascar
259.article_body: Ambassador of India to Madagascar, Abhay Kumar inaugurated a Green Triangle named after Mahatma Gandhi along with Mayor of Antananarivo Naina Andriantsitohaina to mark the Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav on Wednesday. At the ceremony, Kumar said the initiative highlights Gandhi's vision and philosophy when it comes to reducing consumerism, respecting nature and aiming for sustainable development.

260.title: B'luru Police arrests 4 for dacoity bid, seizes machetes & daggers
260.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru City Police on Thursday arrested four persons who were reported to be preparing for dacoity in the city. The crime branch has also seized long machetes and daggers from the possession of the accused persons. Police have registered a case against them at VV Puram Police Station and launched an investigation into the matter.

261.title: boAt launches its first "Made In India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47
261.article_body: boAt has launched its first "Made in India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47 with 1.69" HD display. The smartwatch features a square dial with 500 nits of brightness. With IP67 waterproofing and dust resistance, Wave Pro 47 has up to 7 days of battery life, multiple sports modes, real-time SpO2 monitor, live cricket scores, and customized fitness plans.

262.title: ₹59 cr allotted for Southern Railways, ₹13,200 cr for Northern Railways: DMK MP
262.article_body: DMK MP Kanimozhi has claimed that the budget allocated for Southern Railways towards new lines in 2022-23 is ₹59 crore, whereas the budget allocated for Northern Railways is ₹13,200 crore. She has asked the Union Railway Minister to look into the disparity. "Pointed out the discrimination...in the allocation of funds between South and North India," Kanimozhi tweeted.

263.title: Was kicked out of 13 films, refused to do their films now: Vidya Balan
263.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that she was earlier replaced in 13 films and that she now gets calls from the producers who replaced her. "In the recent times, I have received calls from them (producers who earlier replaced her in their films) but I politely refused to be part of their films," she said.

264.title: Shouted 'don't kill my people'; forgot it was acting: The Kashmir Files actor
264.article_body: The Kashmir Files actor Bhasha Sumbli, who's also a Kashmiri Pandit, revealed that it was emotionally traumatising to relive the brutal massacre in the film. She said, "Vivek sir had cast Kashmiri Pandits there. When they were being shot with bullets, I started shouting...'don't kill my people'." "I had forgotten that acting was happening...I had a panic attack," she added.

265.title: Russian forces stealing food, evicting civilians: Ukraine's Sumy Oblast Guv
265.article_body: Governor Dmytro Zhyvytsky of Ukraine's Sumy Oblast has claimed that the Russian forces are evicting the civilians from their homes and stealing food. Zhyvytsky reportedly gave details about the looting through Telegram on Wednesday. Earlier, reports of Russian troops surviving merely on onions, potatoes and pickles had surfaced after Ukrainian forces seized a battlefield kitchen.

266.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts: UK
266.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence, in the latest Defence Intelligence update on Ukraine situation, said that the Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts. "Russian forces have made minimal progress on land, sea or air in recent days and they continue to suffer heavy losses," it added. "The vast majority of Ukrainian territory...remains in Ukrainian hands," it stated.

267.title: Musk to exit Miss Universe owner Endeavor's board, firm says 'he has little time'
267.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk will resign from the board of directors of Endeavor, with effect from June 30, 2022. "We know he has a lot of demands and little time and we appreciate the support he provided us," the company said. Endeavor owns the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and the Miss Universe pageant.

268.title: Relationship was initially consensual, says Delhi HC as it grants bail to rape accused
268.article_body: Granting bail to a rape accused, the Delhi High Court said it cannot be ignored that he "has clean past antecedents" and that the nature of the relationship between the parties "was initially consensual and went sore". According to the complaint, the accused would pressurise the woman to continue with the relationship and threaten to commit suicide and kill her.

269.title: Indian-origin Miss World runner-up Shree overcame facial burns, Instagram post goes viral
269.article_body: An Instagram post of Shree Saini, the Indian-origin Miss World 2021 runner-up, revealing she suffered burns after a car accident, has gone viral. Sharing a video, she wrote, "I was in a major roll over car accident that left my face with bleeding wounds. I no longer had my face. I couldn't even recognise myself."

270.title: iPhone-maker Foxconn to work under COVID-19 bubble in China: Report
270.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn plans to work under COVID-19 bubble arrangement at its Shenzhen campus in China to resume production until at least Sunday, Reuters reported citing an internal document. The firm has arranged for some staff to live and work in a bubble. Foxconn's major production for iPhone reportedly occurs in Zhengzhou, while only a small part occurs in Shenzhen.

271.title: Lifetime achievement award: Hillary Clinton thanks Russia for sanctions
271.article_body: After Russia imposed sanctions on Hillary Clinton, the former US State Secretary tweeted, "I want to thank the Russian Academy for this Lifetime Achievement Award." Russia on Tuesday had unveiled sanctions against several US political figures, including Clinton and President Joe Biden, in retaliation to US sanctions on Russia over Ukraine war. Clinton and Biden are banned from entering Russia.

272.title: ED issues summons to TMC's Abhishek Banerjee, wife in coal scam case
272.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Abhishek Banerjee and his wife for questioning in connection with the alleged coal scam in West Bengal. Abhishek and his wife have been asked to depose before the investigation officer next week, officials said. This comes after Delhi HC dismissed their plea challenging the summons issued by ED.

273.title: Sri Lanka asks citizens to limit fuel, power consumption amid inflation
273.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has asked the citizens to limit the consumption of fuel and electricity amid protests over rising inflation in the country. "By limiting the use of fuel and electricity, the citizens can extend their support to the country," Rajapaksa said. He added that the government has asked the International Monetary Fund to allow deferring loan repayments.

274.title: IPS officer's bag found to be fully filled with peas at Jaipur airport; pic goes viral
274.article_body: IPS officer Arun Bothra has shared a picture showing a bag full of peas on Twitter. "Security staff at Jaipur airport asked to open my handbag," Bothra, who is Transport Commissioner of Odisha, wrote along with the picture. The picture shared by Bothra has gone viral with over 50,000 likes.

275.title: Pune woman books cake online, loses ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster
275.article_body: A woman in Pune lost ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster after she was made to share her bank details after booking a cake online. The woman shared an OTP that she received, after which the money was debited in five transactions. Police have booked unidentified fraudster under Sections 419 and 420 of Indian Penal Code and sections of Information Technology Act.

276.title: India will face challenge in 5 of their remaining 7 WTC Tests: Saba Karim
276.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said India are likely to face challenges in five of their remaining seven Tests in the ongoing World Test Championship cycle. "India will face challenge in the only Test that's going to be played in England and the four against Australia [at home]," he added. Apart from these, India will tour Bangladesh for two-Test series.

277.title: Sanitation workers' fatalities reduced to 24 in 2021: Centre
277.article_body: The number of fatalities due to cleaning of hazardous sewers and septic tanks has come down in the country, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. The number of such deaths reduced to 24 in 2021 compared to 118 in 2019, he said. He further informed that a national policy for mechanised sanitation eco-system has been prepared.

278.title: 3 Panama-flagged ships hit by Russian missiles in Black Sea
278.article_body: Three Panamanian-flagged ships have been hit by Russian missiles in the Black Sea since Russia invaded Ukraine last month, Panamanian authorities said. One ship sank but others remain afloat with damages, Noriel Arauz, Panama Maritime Authority administrator, said. At least 10 other Panama-flagged ships are in the Black Sea, Arauz added, saying the Russian Navy is restricting them from leaving.

279.title: Learn from Indian curators how to prepare turners: Aaqib Javed to PCB
279.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said the PCB should learn from Indian curators how to prepare turning tracks. "I am surprised until now Pakistan has not been able to produce pure turning tracks, which will help our spinners," added Javed. The pitches for Pakistan's two Test matches played so far at home against Australia have drawn criticism.

280.title: Islamic Centre of India urges mosques to alter Friday prayer timings amid Holi
280.article_body: The Islamic Centre of India has urged mosques to change the timings for Friday prayers amid the festival of Holi. Further, with Shab-e-Barat also falling on the same day, it asked Muslims to visit mosques and graves of their loved ones after 5 pm. Notably, 22 mosques have pushed the timings of Friday prayers after 1:30 pm.

281.title: AMD Days Sale is now live on Amazon
281.article_body: AMD Days Sale on Amazon is now live with offers on thin and light, and gaming laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors. Customers can avail No Cost EMI, exchange offers, and free Prime membership from a wide range of laptops from HP, Lenovo, Acer, Dell, ASUS and MSI. The sale ends on March 19.

282.title: Witnessed how keen Rishi was to complete 'Sharmaji...' after treatment: Neetu
282.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a video of actor and son Ranbir Kapoor talking about his late father Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "This movie will always be very close to my heart!!! I witnessed the excitement when he started the movie and how keen he was to complete it after the treatment," she wrote.

283.title: A very big decision in the interest of Punjabis will be announced shortly: CM Mann
283.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday tweeted, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab." "No one in the history of Punjab would have taken such a decision till date. I'll announce shortly," he added. Mann was sworn in as the CM of the state on Wednesday.

284.title: Lead coffin, likely from 14th cnetury, found under Paris' Notre Dame
284.article_body: Archaeologists have found an ancient lead sarcophagus with well-preserved contents, probably from the 14th century, under Paris' Notre Dame cathedral. Christophe Besnier from France's National Archaeological Institute said a small camera placed inside the sarcophagus showed "cloth remains, organic matter such as hair and plant remains". A pit was also found immediately below the cathedral floor.

285.title: Let them throw me out: Teejay on not being allowed to board Dubai flight over visa issue
285.article_body: Actress Teejay Sidhu was stranded at Delhi airport after not being allowed to board Dubai flight with her three daughters over visa issue. Teejay, who missed the initial flight, claimed Emirates staff members were rude to her and also threatened to call security. She said they weren't allowing her to stay at airport premises, adding, "Let them throw me out."

286.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy personally wrote to Zuckerberg to block Facebook in Russia: Report
286.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reportedly wrote letters to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg asking them to ban Facebook and Instagram from within Russia's borders. However, Meta's President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg replied to the letters, the report said. Facebook restricted certain Russian state media outlets in Ukraine after Zelenskyy's request, it added.

287.title: Delhi Police opposes Shahrukh Pathan's bail plea in 2020 firing case
287.article_body: Delhi Police has opposed the bail plea of Shahrukh Pathan who is accused of allegedly pointing a gun at a constable during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots and firing three-four rounds of shots. He has a family history of criminal cases, police added. "The accused has been keeping illegal arms and ammunition...has no remorse for his illegal act," police added.

288.title: Mamata Banerjee conspiring to make WB another Pakistan: BJP's Arjun Singh
288.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is "conspiring to make West Bengal another Pakistan". Singh stated that Banerjee is against the Bihari migrants in the state. "Mamata Banerjee has always been against Biharis. Industries in the state are being shut down so that they don't work...Bihar people have given us labour force," Singh said.

289.title: UP man puts tractor silencer on bike, writes 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' on number plate
289.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested three men for riding a bike with the number plate reading 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' and have seized their bike. The arrested men were identified as Ankit Paal, Anuj Paal and Shivam. Photos showed that the bike was modified and the accused had replaced the silencer of the bike with a tractor's silencer.

290.title: Big B invited us to dinner after Satte Pe Satta got completed: Shakti
290.article_body: Actor Shakti Kapoor said he can watch Satte Pe Satta 200 times. "I watch it whenever I'm sad," he added. The actor recalled that Amitabh Bachchan invited the entire cast for dinner after the film's shoot got completed. "That evening was...fun that we started at 8:30 pm and wrapped it up by 7 am...It was an unforgettable experience," he added.

291.title: Pics show Ukraine theatre before and after Russia dropped powerful bomb
291.article_body: Ukraine's Minister of Foreign Affairs Dmytro Kuleba has posted pics showing the Mariupol theatre before and after Russia dropped a powerful bomb. "Another horrendous war crime in Mariupol...The building is now fully ruined," he wrote. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov had said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building.

292.title: Good luck finding a wife: Sunny Leone to man who got tattoo of her name
292.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a video with a man who has a tattoo of her name on his arm. "Hope you love me forever!! Because now you have no choice. Good luck finding a wife," she captioned the video. She can be seen wearing yellow and pink saree in video and thanking man with the tattoo.

293.title: Felt horrible, angry from inside during film research: 'The Kashmir...' writer
293.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' writer Saurabh M Pandey said that he felt horrible during the research for the film. "I had to switch to other work...I had to give it some time, I used to feel why did these things happen, used to be very angry from inside...used to be upset and angry at the same time," he added.

294.title: 73,219 posts vacant in paramilitary forces: Nityanand Rai
294.article_body: As many as 73,219 posts are vacant in paramilitary forces due to retirements, resignations, deaths and cadre reviews, MoS for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament on Wednesday. "Filling up of vacancies is an ongoing continuous process which is done as per the administrative and operational requirement of the forces," Rai added.

295.title: 3 earthquakes jolt Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh in a day
295.article_body: Three earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. While two earthquakes with magnitude 5.2 and 4.3 hit Ladakh at 7:05 pm and 7:34 pm respectively, another earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Ritcher scale hit Srinagar at 9:40 pm.

296.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in the world right now: Vaughan
296.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has termed Pakistan captain Babar Azam as the best batter across formats at the moment. "Brilliant across formats," tweeted Vaughan after Babar scored 196 during the second innings in their second Test against Australia. Babar is currently top-ranked batter in ICC rankings in ODIs and T20Is and among the top 10 in Tests.

297.title: Russians shouldn't pay for their authoritarian leader: Patreon CEO
297.article_body: Patreon CEO Jack Conte in an interview said the firm continues to operate in Russia, adding he doesn't believe individual creators "should have to pay for the misdeeds of their authoritarian leader". "They may disagree with the war, and I don't want to punish them," he added. Conte also said the decision on operations was not controversial internally at Patreon.

298.title: 1.75 crore houses completed under PM Awas Yojana-Gramin: Centre
298.article_body: As many as 1.75 crore houses have been completed under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Gramin (PMAY-G), MoS for Rural Development Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti said. Around 2.28 crore houses were sanctioned to the beneficiaries till March 9, 2022, she added. Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of PMAY-G till March 2024 for completion of remaining houses, Jyoti stated.

299.title: Saba Khan shares mother Sharmila Tagore's pics with Pandit Jawaharal Nehru
299.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan took to Instagram to share a video of her mother Sharmila Tagore's pictures, including one with India's first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. "A star is born...a child protégé...a star. Proud of you! Wish you life's best moments, always...Keep shining," Saba captioned the post.

300.title: Never beaten Deepika in badminton despite trying for 10 years: Ranveer
300.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he has "never" beaten wife and actress Deepika Padukone in badminton, despite trying for 10 years. "Deepika kicks my butt in badminton. I am running around sweating," added Ranveer. Ranveer and Deepika were last seen together in the film '83'. While Ranveer played cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Deepika played his wife Romi.

301.title: Want to hold on to that forever: Kim on finding happiness with Pete Davidson
301.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with Pete Davidson, Kim Kardashian said that she decided to seek her happiness and she found it. "I was like...'I'm in my 40s like f**k it...go for it. Find your happiness'," she added. Kim further said she feels "so good" after finding happiness with Pete. "I want to hold on to that forever," she added.

302.title: The tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone: Kirron on 'The Kashmir...'
302.article_body: Talking about 'The Kashmir Files' which stars her husband-actor Anupam Kher, actor-politician Kirron Kher tweeted, "The stark and tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone." "It is the chronicling of a humanitarian crisis that was ignored for...years," added Kirron. "[Director] Vivek Agnihotri used to hug me..., we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles," Anupam had earlier said.

303.title: For weeks I have been heckled, threatened, questioned: Man Utd’s Rashford
303.article_body: Reacting to a video of him arguing with a fan who "abused" him after Manchester United's exit from Champions League, forward Marcus Rashford said, "For weeks I've been heckled, threatened, questioned..., my emotion got the better of me." "I [have] been heckled from the minute I stepped foot outside the ground, abuse not just aimed at my football," added Rashford.

304.title: 61,882 arrested in drug trafficking cases in 2021: Govt
304.article_body: A total of 61,882 persons were arrested by the central and state Drug Law Enforcement Agencies (DLEAs) in drug trafficking cases across the country in 2021, the government informed on Wednesday. Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said 99.36% of them were Indians, 0.64% were foreign nationals as per the provisional data of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB).

305.title: People with new COVID variant had mild symptoms of fever, headaches, muscle dystrophy
305.article_body: Israel has said that two patients who have tested positive for a new variant of COVID-19 had mild symptoms of fever, headaches and muscle dystrophy. It however said that they did not require any special medical intervention. The variant may have originated in Israel, health ministry director-general Nachman Ash said.

306.title: Year's 1st cyclone 'Asani' likely to form over Bay of Bengal on March 21: IMD
306.article_body: This year's first cyclone, 'Asani', is likely to form over the central Bay of Bengal on March 21, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). It is unlikely to cross the Indian coast but heavy rain and strong winds are expected over Andaman and Nicobar Islands. "Our models indicate Asani may cross Bangladesh or adjoining north Myanmar coasts," said an IMD official.

307.title: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
307.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

308.title: Next two months are going to be special: Rahul as he joins LSG's bubble
308.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul entered the mandatory three-day quarantine ahead of the IPL season and said that the next two months are going to be very special. "The new season gives us a great opportunity as a new franchise to do something special," he added. LSG will play their first match against Gujarat Titans on March 28.

309.title: It told us where we stand: Nagaland captain as Jharkhand score 1,297 runs
309.article_body: Jharkhand qualified for the quarterfinals of the Ranji Trophy 2021-22 after taking a lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland, having scored 1,297 runs across both innings. Nagaland captain Rongsen Jonathan said he is "happy" to concede 1,297 runs in a match, as it tells them where they stand. Jharkhand's 1,008-run lead marks the highest-ever lead in a first-class match.

310.title: Thought Lara will struggle with on-drives, he hit 3 fours in 1 over: Muralitharan
310.article_body: Muttiah Muralitharan said he tried to dismiss Brian Lara by opening the mid-on area to encourage him to play on-drives, which were difficult to play with the ball spinning during Lara's 221 in Colombo back in 2001. "[Lara] hit three fours in the mid-on region in one over," added Muralitharan. "I am...amazed by the shots [he] played," stated Muralitharan.

311.title: 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners identified, over 30,000 deported: Assam govt
311.article_body: More than 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners have been identified till January 31 on the basis of the Assam Accord, out of which 30,014 have been deported to their country of origin, said the state government on Wednesday. Minister Atul Bora added that 98.35% of fencing work along the India-Bangladesh border in the state has been completed.

312.title: 2 men on high-end racing bike snatch woman's gold chain in Pune; case filed
312.article_body: Two men, riding a high-end racing bike, allegedly snatched a gold chain from a woman riding pillion with her husband on his motorcycle in Pune. The incident reportedly happened on Tuesday night when the couple was returning home after purchasing groceries. The couple has lodged an FIR at Nigdi Police Station. Attempts are on to arrest the robbers, police said.

313.title: 5 arrested for stealing gun of Raghav Chadha's security officer in Punjab
313.article_body: The Nawanshahr police have arrested five persons accused of stealing a revolver from AAP leader Raghav Chadha's security officer during the party's victory roadshow in Amritsar. The police said that the accused were caught after they hit a car with their Scorpio while travelling from Nawanshahr to Khatkar Kalan. The police recovered the stolen revolver during checking.

314.title: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
314.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.

315.title: Delhi court grants bail to man who tried to break into NSA Doval's house
315.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to a man who was arrested in February for trying to break into National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval's residence on Tughlaq Road. "Considering...the background of accused and the fact that accused is in custody since February 16 and no more is required for investigation, the accused/applicant is admitted to bail," the court added.

316.title: How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?: Cong's Randeep Surjewala
316.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala criticised the Centre and said, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?" He added, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been given jobs?" Addressing a press event, Surjewala said that atrocities had been occurring even during the VP Singh-led government. "Only one party protested. Opposition leader Rajiv Gandhi gheraoed the Parliament," Surjewala added.

317.title: Man hits friend with stone, stabs him to death after argument in Nagpur
317.article_body: A man killed his 24-year-old friend after an argument in Nagpur's Kalmana area. Reports said that the two were consuming alcohol and that the accused slit the victim's throat following an argument, after which, the victim started running. But the accused caught him and hit him in the head with a stone. He then stabbed the victim to death.

318.title: Rizwan saved the Test for us eventually: Babar on Karachi Test
318.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said it was Mohammad Rizwan who saved Karachi Test for them against Australia after he remained unbeaten at 104. "We took the onus and the main focus was to build partnerships right throughout the day," said Babar, who himself scored 196 runs during their chase of 506 runs. Abdullah Shafique scored 96 in the innings.

319.title: BSF seizes 2 Pakistani fishing boats in Gujarat's Bhuj
319.article_body: Two Pakistani boats were seized by the Border Security Force (BSF) at Sir Creek area in Gujarat's Bhuj on Wednesday. "Movement of two Pakistani fishing boats and four-five Pakistani fishermen was observed by...BSF. The Pakistani fishermen on observing the BSF troops coming towards them fled into the Pakistani territory...BSF...chased them and seized two...boats," BSF said in a statement.

320.title: UK warns Russia 'likely resorting to less precise weapons'
320.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry on Thursday said Russia's failure to control Ukrainian airspace means it has probably "expended far more stand-off air launched weapons than originally planned". "As a result, it is likely Russia is resorting to the use of older, less precise weapons, which are less militarily effective and more likely to result in civilian casualties," the ministry added.

321.title: Shreyas can look 25 & 42 at same time: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad
321.article_body: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad Desai said actor Shreyas Talpade can look 25 and 42 at same time. "We always wanted somebody who embodies the body language, the physicality of a cricketer...Shreyas is a powerhouse performer...I was glad when we got to know that he had agreed to come on board and he has delivered an exemplary performance," he added.

322.title: Mumbai lost over 2,000 hectares of urban tree cover in 5 years: Study
322.article_body: Mumbai lost about 2,028 hectares of urban tree cover in the past five years, a study by World Resources Institute (WRI) India revealed. The data published in the Mumbai Climate Action Plan (MCAP) said Central and Western Mumbai recorded the maximum decrease in tree cover. The loss contributed to emission of 19,640.9 tonnes of CO2 per year, the report added.

323.title: Grandmother asks Guj man who he's talking to on call, he hits her with ladle
323.article_body: A 21-year-old man hit his 69-year-old grandmother with a ladle after she asked who he was speaking to over the phone. The grandson, Ruchit, reportedly started abusing her. The woman, Shanta Supehia, asked him not to use foul language against her, following which, he hit her with the ladle. Shanta then started bleeding and her husband came to her rescue.

324.title: Dharmendra shares pic with son Sunny, says 'Rare chance to be with him'
324.article_body: Taking to Twitter, veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture with his son Sunny Deol, from a vacation in the mountains. The photo showed them posing for the camera with a large, snow-capped mountain behind them. Sharing the picture, Dharmendra wrote, "Extremely happy to be with Sunny. A rare chance to [be] with each other."

325.title: Officials to evaluate pollution impact of Supertech towers demolition
325.article_body: Ahead of the Supertech twin towers demolition in Noida Sector 93A, the state pollution control board will evaluate the amount of pollution which will be caused in the process. "With regard to...pollution aspect, laws will have to be complied (with)," said UPPCB officer Praveen Kumar. The process is expected to briefly cause a spike in the quantity of dust particles.

326.title: Thane man dies by suicide with 11-yr-old daughter, blames police officer
326.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide along with his 11-year-old daughter in Shahapur town of Thane. Victim Vikas Kedare allegedly blamed a police officer in a two-page suicide note, police said. According to police, Kedare and his mother were arrested after his wife died by suicide last year. He was released after spending four months in jail, police added.

327.title: South Korea reports record 6 lakh COVID-19 cases and record 429 deaths in 24 hours
327.article_body: South Korea reported a record 6,21,328 new daily COVID-19 cases, and a record 429 daily deaths, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Thursday, amid a wave of Omicron infections. The country reported 55% increase in daily COVID-19 cases. South Korea had reported 4,00,741 cases on Wednesday.

328.title: Hardik Pandya passes Yo-Yo test at NCA, Prithvi Shaw fails it: Reports
328.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya passed Yo-Yo test at a camp at NCA in Bengaluru, while Delhi Capitals' Prithvi Shaw failed it, reports said. The standard score to clear the test is 16.5. As per reports, Shaw scored less than 15, while Hardik scored more than 17 in the test. Hardik also bowled regularly at the camp, reports added.

329.title: World's biggest telescope captures star with ancient galaxies in background, pic released
329.article_body: James Webb Space Telescope, the world's biggest and most powerful space telescope, completed its final round of fine phasing to correct its alignment errors. During the process, the telescope focussed on a single star, however, several ancient galaxies and stars also showed up in the background due to the telescope's sensitive optics. NASA released a picture of the star.

330.title: Delhi's air quality improves to 'moderate' category; AQI at 190
330.article_body: Delhi's air pollution level improved on Thursday morning with the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 190 as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). According to SAFAR, the AQI improved due to an increase in the maximum temperature. Further, Gurugram and Noida recorded an AQI of 149 and 193 respectively on Thursday morning.

331.title: Indian-American contestant Shree Saini becomes 1st runner-up at Miss World 2021
331.article_body: Punjab-born Shree Saini was crowned the first runner-up at the 70th Miss World beauty pageant held in Puerto Rico. She is the first Indian-American to win Miss World America. Having completed her Bachelor's Degree in Journalism, Shree is currently working as a Business Manager at her father's company and as a Keynote Speaker.

332.title: Govt admits IIM-Rohtak Director didn't meet qualification criterion but was still appointed
332.article_body: After repeated denials, the Union Government has admitted to the court that IIM-Rohtak Director Dheeraj Sharma, whom it had appointed, did not meet the minimum educational qualification criterion. He was appointed despite securing a second division at the undergraduate level. Sharma completed his five-year term on February 9 this year and has got a second term.

333.title: Netflix tests charging a fee for sharing accounts outside households
333.article_body: Netflix is testing charging a fee to subscribers who share accounts with people outside their households. The sharing of accounts is "impacting our ability to invest in great new TV and films", Netflix said. The feature will be tested in Chile, Costa Rica and Peru, allowing users to add two people who don't live with them, for an extra charge.

334.title: Sensex jumps 1,000 points after US Fed's 1st rate hike in 3 years
334.article_body: Indian benchmark indices gained over 1.5% on Thursday, tracking gains in the global markets, following the US Federal Reserve's first rate hike in over three years. The Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade above 57,800, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 280 points to trade at 17,250 levels. HDFC and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among top gainers.

335.title: 4 killed, over 90 injured after 7.4 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
335.article_body: At least four people have been killed and over 90 have been injured after a 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck northern Japan on Wednesday night and prompted a tsunami warning. Tens of thousands of households have been left without power after the earthquake. The quake struck the same region where a powerful earthquake triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster 11 years ago.

336.title: Powerful bomb dropped by Russia on theatre sheltering 1,000-1,200 people in Ukraine
336.article_body: Russian forces dropped a powerful bomb on a theatre in Ukraine's Mariupol on Wednesday, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building. Russia's Defence Ministry said its forces had not struck the building and instead accused the Azov Battalion, a far-right Ukrainian militia, of blowing it up.

337.title: Russians, Ukrainians facing attacks in Germany, say police
337.article_body: The German police have said that they have registered at least 500 reports of politically motivated attacks against the Russian and Ukrainian communities in the country since the conflict between the two countries broke out. Some bottles were reportedly thrown at the windows of a Russian church in Berlin. In another incident, a Ukrainian refugee family's car was burned.

338.title: You won't see players playing for ₹16 cr in PSL: Aakash on Raja's remark on IPL
338.article_body: Reacting to PCB chief Ramiz Raja's remark that players will choose PSL over IPL if they go for auction, commentator Aakash Chopra said, "You won't see a player playing for ₹16 crore in the PSL...market dynamics [won't] allow that." Aakash added, "Chris Morris' one ball, when he played last time, was more expensive than the players' salary in other leagues."

339.title: Honour to watch him bat: Eng batting coach on Root's 2nd straight Test ton
339.article_body: England batting coach Marcus Trescothick has said it's an honour to see England Test captain Joe Root bat during the matches. Root slammed his second hundred in as many innings after scoring 119* off 246 on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test against West Indies. "To get a hundred last week and repeat it again, it's superb," Trescothick added.

340.title: US' Amagi, founded by 3 Indians, turns unicorn after raising $95 mn
340.article_body: US-based SaaS mediatech startup Amagi has become a unicorn after raising $95 million led by Accel. Others who participated in the funding include Norwest Venture Partners and Avataar Ventures. Founded by three Indians, Baskar Subramanian, KA Srinivasan and Srividhya Srinivasan, Amagi has raised over $245 million to date. It had raised $100 million around six months ago.

341.title: Want to live your best life? Make it happen: Godrej Park Retreat
341.article_body: Spread across 13 acres, Godrej Park Retreat offers 1, 2 and 3 BHK apartments in Sarjapur Road, Bangalore. Godrej Properties revealed that the township is situated close to the best hospitals, educational institutions, hotels, recreation centres and many large tech parks. Godrej Park Retreat has a clubhouse, 50+ amenities and 4.06 acres of greens.

342.title: Karan, Ananya & Manish attend Shweta Bachchan's b'day party, pics surface
342.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's daughter, Shweta Bachchan, celebrated her 48th birthday on Wednesday. Several Bollywood celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, Karan Johar, Ananya Panday, Manish Malhotra, Sidharth Malhotra and Shanaya Kapoor attended the party. As pictures surfaced online, Shweta seemingly kept white as the colour theme for her guests' outfits.

343.title: Ill-fated van was bought days ago: Mother of Indian student killed in Canada
343.article_body: Mother of 24-year-old Harpreet Singh, who was one of the five Indian students killed in a road mishap in Canada, said that the "ill-fated van had been purchased merely a few days ago". "For the last two years, he had been working as a driver on a work permit. He had been driving students from Brampton to Montreal," she added.

344.title: Only 60 aged 12-15 yrs get vaccinated in Pune as CoWIN glitch halts process
344.article_body: Only 60 children aged between 12 to 15 years could get vaccinated on first day of vaccination process for them in Pune. The Pune Municipal Corporation had set up 29 centres for vaccination of the age group. However, no registrations could be done due to glitch in the CoWin website. The website reportedly only started working post-lunch hours.

345.title: Govt to implement ₹7,500-cr scheme to tackle road mishaps: Nitin Gadkari
345.article_body: The Centre said it is planning to partner with the World Bank to implement a ₹7,500-crore scheme to reduce accident-prone areas and black spots on national and state highways, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said. India doesn't have a good record on road accident front and registers the world’s highest deaths due to it at 1.5 lakh every year, Gadkari added.

346.title: Over 2 lakh kids in 12-14 age group given COVID vaccine doses on Day 1
346.article_body: As many as 2,60,136 kids aged 12-14 were given COVID-19 vaccine doses on the first day as vaccination for 12-14 age group started on Wednesday, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. More than 2.15 crore precaution doses for identified categories of beneficiaries (HCWs, FLWs and over 60 years) for COVID-19 vaccination have been administered so far, the Ministry added.

347.title: Who voted for and who voted against Russia at ICJ over Ukraine invasion?
347.article_body: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) asked Russia to immediately halt its invasion of Ukraine in a 13-2 decision. Out of the 15 judges at the ICJ, judges from USA, Slovakia, France, Morocco, Somalia, Uganda, India, Jamaica, Lebanon, Japan, Germany, Australia and Judge ad hoc  Yves Daudet voted against Russia. Judges from Russia and China voted for Russia.

348.title: BJP MLA demands separate state of North Bengal in WB Assembly
