348.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling's Kurseong, Bishnu Prasad Sharma, on Wednesday demanded a separate state of North Bengal in the West Bengal Assembly. "The hills have been deprived for a very long time. Various communities...such as Gorkhas, Rajbanshis, Adivasis have been deprived," Sharma added. "We want North Bengal to be a separate state so that our problems are addressed," he stated.

349.title: Only 101 children turn up for vaccination in Chandigarh Tricity on Day 1
349.article_body: The COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years which kicked off on Wednesday, opened to a poor response in Chandigarh Tricity with only 101 kids showing up to get the jab. The first dose of the Corbevax vaccine was administered to four, 37 and 60 children in Mohali, Chandigarh and Panchkula respectively on the first day.

350.title: Who is Miss World 2021 winner Karolina Bielawska?
350.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska, who has been crowned Miss World 2021, is currently studying for a Master's Degree in Management and would like to continue her studies with a PhD. She also works as a model and hopes to become a motivational speaker. "She enjoys swimming and scuba diving and playing tennis and badminton," read a post by Miss World organisation.

351.title: Deepfake video shows Zelenskyy telling Ukrainians to surrender; he calls it 'childish'
351.article_body: A video purportedly showing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calling on his country's forces to lay down arms is a "deepfake", Meta said, removing the video from Facebook. Zelenskyy also rebutted the video, calling it a "childish provocation". "I only advise that the troops of the Russian Federation lay down their arms and return home," he said.

352.title: Who is Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at ICJ?
352.article_body: Justice Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at the International Court of Justice, was born in Jodhpur. Bhandari practised at the Rajasthan High Court from 1968 to 1970 and then went to US on an international scholarship to pursue a Master of Laws degree. He also served as a senior judge of the Supreme Court of India.

353.title: Military operation in Ukraine developing successfully: Putin
353.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that the military operation in Ukraine was developing successfully. "The operation is developing successfully and in strict accordance with plans," he said. Asserting that Russia had no other option than to send troops, he added, "We will not allow Ukraine to serve as a springboard for aggressive actions against Russia."

354.title: I'm practising hard, not thinking too much about Team India call-up: Dhawan
354.article_body: Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan, who'll feature for PBKS in the upcoming IPL season, has said he's practising hard and not thinking too much about the Team India call-up. "If it doesn't happen then [also] I'm happy and without tension," he stated. Dhawan's appearance has been limited to ODIs since he was dropped from India's 2021 T20I World Cup squad.

355.title: Got fired for reviewing Tesla's FSD tech on YouTube: Ex-US employee
355.article_body: A former US Tesla employee John Bernal has claimed he was fired after he posted reviews on Tesla's driverless tech on his YouTube channel. He said his YouTube channel was cited as the reason for his dismissal. Bernal said Tesla also cut off his access to the FSD Beta system in the vehicle he personally owns.

356.title: Labourer kills co-worker, dumps body on river bank in Pune; arrested
356.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 36-year-old labourer for killing a co-worker and dumping his body on the banks of Mula river. "One of them had sold a phone to the other and payment was pending. A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

357.title: India reports 2,539 new COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths; active cases at 30,799
357.article_body: India has reported 2,539 new COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 60 deaths, 22 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 38 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,132, and the active cases declined to 30,799.

358.title: What was the answer that won Poland's Karolina Bielawska the Miss World 2021 crown?
358.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was asked, "What's the most important discovery yet to be discovered?" "We all have unique experiences and all of us can learn something about ourselves...It costs us so little to enrich others' lives," she said. "If you'd like to discover something new, try to learn to be rich in more empathy, in compassion, in gratitude," Karolina added.

359.title: I wouldn't change too much, but catches could've made the difference: Cummins
359.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has said he wouldn't change too much in terms of their tactics in the second Test against Pakistan, which ended in a draw after Pakistan managed to save three wickets. He, however, also admitted that missed catches in the second innings could've made the difference. Australia missed at least four catches in Pakistan's second innings.

360.title: Girls who questioned hijab verdict are members of terror body: BJP leader
360.article_body: BJP leader Yashpal Suvarna, who is also Vice-President of Udupi Government PU College Development Committee, on Wednesday said that the girls who questioned Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban are "anti-national" and "members of a terrorist organisation". "The girls have proved once again that they are not students but members of a terrorist organisation," he said.

361.title: PM & govt must rise above petty politics, propaganda films: Owaisi
361.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Narendra Modi and the Centre must rise above their "petty politics" and "propaganda films", criticising Union Minister Rajnath Singh's statement concerning the accidental missile-firing which landed in Pakistan. Citing a report claiming, India's accidental missile-firing prompted Pakistan to prepare a retaliatory strike, Owaisi said Singh's statement told nothing.

362.title: 19-yr-old girl steals ₹8 lakh from home, elopes with man in Zirakpur
362.article_body: A 19-year-old girl and her 22-year-old boyfriend were booked by police after the girl stole ₹8 lakh from her home and eloped with the man. The girl's family alleged the man instigated their daughter into stealing the money after luring her with marriage. She went missing on February 28. Her parents found she eloped with her boyfriend through her friends.

363.title: All truth-seekers should watch 'The Kashmir Files': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
363.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that all the truth-seekers should watch the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. His remarks came after meeting the movie's director Vivek Agnihotri and actress Pallavi Joshi in New Delhi. "A brilliantly written script, a complete artistic work and a thorough research," Bhagwat said. The movie was released in theatres on March 11.

364.title: Don’t Memorise acquired by Infinity Learn
364.article_body: Infinity Learn by Sri Chaitanya announced acquisition of Don't Memorise, a multilingual YouTube content platform, founded by Ganesh Pai. Ujjwal Singh, CEO of Infinity Learn, said he welcomes 2.5 million users to its family with open arms. Ganesh calls this acquisition a golden opportunity to develop more K-10 learning solutions and scale their YouTube channel even more.

365.title: Don't want anyone to reduce my achievements: Vidya on not working with husband
365.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, who's married to producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, said they decided not to work together after their 2013 film 'Ghanchakkar'. "I don't want anyone to reduce my achievements to saying this happened for you because of your husband," she added. "One has worked...hard to get here and...I don't want that to happen for either of us," Vidya said.

366.title: Bappi Lahiri's daughter breaks down as his grandson sings late singer's song
366.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's daughter Rema Lahiri broke down at an event when her son Swastik Bansal sang one of the late singer's songs at an event recently. In his tribute, Swastik sang 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna' which was composed by Bappi Lahiri and sung by Kishore Kumar. Swastik also broke down towards the end of his performance.

367.title: Doing our best to ensure production at Shanghai plant: Tesla
367.article_body: Tesla has said it is doing its best to keep production going at its Shanghai factory amid China's COVID-19 prevention measures. This comes after a Reuters report said the firm had suspended production at the plant for two days. "We are actively cooperating with the government's requirements for nucleic acid testing and other epidemic prevention requirements," Tesla said.

368.title: Pune's double-decker flyover opened for public, to reduce traffic congestion
368.article_body: Pune's double-decker Nal Stop flyover has been opened for public use. It will help in reduction of traffic congestion on Karve Road in the city. "At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it's important to have a flyover on this stretch," Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol had earlier said.

369.title: Liquor shops closed for 2 days in Hyd's Rachakonda ahead of Holi
369.article_body: Liquor shops will remain closed for two days from 6 pm on Thursday to 6 am on Saturday within Rachakonda Commissionerate limits ahead of Holi, police said. Wine shops, toddy shops and bars attached to restaurants, excluding those attached to star hotels and clubs, would be closed, police added. Groups moving aimlessly on their vehicles are prohibited, police stated.

370.title: 'The Kashmir Files' didn't show complete truth, only violence: C'garh CM
370.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files' with several MLAs on Wednesday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the film did not show the complete truth and the makers only tried to highlight violence. "The film did not have any message. No attempt to offer any solution was made. I don't believe such a film has any relevance," said Baghel.

371.title: Bengaluru police arrest interstate car thief; recover SUVs worth ₹4 crore
371.article_body: Bengaluru police arrested a car thief who allegedly orchestrated at least 21 thefts in Bengaluru, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana. Police have recovered SUVs worth ₹4 crore from the accused, who has reportedly been involved in car thefts since 2003. "Accused used hacking devices and key-making machines to unlock high-end cars," Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop Shetty said.

372.title: Poland's Karolina Bielawska crowned Miss World 2021, India's Manasa reaches semi-final
372.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was crowned Miss World 2021 by Jamaica's Toni-Ann Singh, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. US' Shree Saini was named first runner-up while Olivia Yace from Cote d'Ivoire was named second runner-up. Manasa Varanasi, who represented India, was among the semi-finalists. The event was earlier scheduled to take place in December 2021, but was postponed due to COVID-19.

373.title: Joe Biden calls Putin 'war criminal', Russia says it's 'unacceptable'
373.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for the first time, after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the US Congress. He also offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine that includes armed drones. Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the comments made by Biden were "unforgivable rhetoric" and "unacceptable", as per state-run TASS.

374.title: US woman abused online after being mistaken for Russian Foreign Minister's daughter
374.article_body: A US realtor has been abused online by people mistaking her for daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov amid the war in Ukraine. Ekaterina Lavrova said, "People wish you to burn in hell, you know, 'you should be deported,' 'let's take over her apartment and host somebody from Ukraine.'" Lavrov's daughter shares the same name as the US realtor.

375.title: Sharapova, Schumacher booked for fraud for promoting Gurugram real estate project
375.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked former Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova and former Formula 1 racer Michael Schumacher for fraud and criminal conspiracy. Delhi's Shafali Agarwal complained she booked an apartment in a project named after Sharapova and was cheated of nearly ₹80 lakh. Agarwal complained Sharapova made false promises, had dinner parties with buyers but the project never took off.

376.title: Actress Park Ha-sun contributes to emergency relief in Ukraine
376.article_body: South Korean actress Park Ha-sun contributed to an emergency relief campaign to help Ukraine, her agency reportedly said. It added that the donation will be used to "purchase food and daily necessities for Ukrainian children and residents suffering from the war". She reportedly donated 10 million won (over ₹6 lakh) to NGO 'Korea Food for the Hungry International' (KFHI).

377.title: Went through depression, he was the only one who didn't leave: Shama on James
377.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who recently got married to American businessman James Milliron said that he did not leave her during her phase of depression. "I would get depressed...I did not want anybody around me...I would push them to go away...everybody would leave...he was the only one who did not leave," she said. "James said 'Sorry, I can't leave'," she added.

378.title: India's judge votes against Russia over Ukraine invasion at International Court of Justice
378.article_body: India's judge at International Court of Justice, Justice Dalveer Bhandari, voted against Russia as the UN's top court asked Russia to immediately stop its invasion of Ukraine. Thirteen judges voted against Russia, while two judges voted in favour of Russia. Earlier, India had abstained from voting on the Ukraine-Russia issue at the UN Security Council and UN General Assembly.

379.title: 3,837 kids vaccinated in Delhi on Day 1 of vaccination for 12-14 yrs old
379.article_body: As many as 3,837 kids were vaccinated against COVID-19 in Delhi on Wednesday which was the first day of vaccination for those in the 12-14 age group. Northeast Delhi vaccinated the maximum number of children at 2,310, followed by North Delhi at 362. About six to seven lakh children in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccination in Delhi.

380.title: Philippines designer makes gowns, dresses out of recycled waste
380.article_body: A designer from Philippines has been making dresses out of waste materials like recycled newspapers, plastic wrapping and rice sacks using a foot-operated sewing machine. Seamstress Leonora Buenviaje said clothes made from such items are both economical and fashionable. Her frocks and gowns, which she weaves out of plastic, are sometimes used in beauty contests and pageants, Reuters reported.

381.title: Pune Police forms special squads to maintain vigil on Holi
381.article_body: The Pune Police has formed special squads at the police station level to maintain a vigil on anti-social elements during Holi celebrations. The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation Commissionerate has also formed around 10 such squads. Officials will patrol streets in civil clothes and police teams will be stationed in sensitive areas.

382.title: Delhi Traffic Police details measures to ensure safe Holi celebrations
382.article_body: Delhi Police Joint Commissioner (Traffic) Vivek Kishore said police personnel will be deployed on all major roads and intersections on the occasion of Holi (March 18). He also urged citizens to avoid traffic violations like drunken driving, overspeeding and triple-riding. Delhi's Food Safety Department has also directed officials to ensure adulterated food products are not sold during Holi.

383.title: Air purifiers to be installed at traffic intersections in Mumbai
383.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install air purifiers at traffic intersections to reduce the impact of carbon emissions in the city. BMC has identified 70 traffic junctions where these purifiers will likely be installed in the days to come, senior civic officials said. One purifier has already been set up at the Mahapalika Marg near BMC headquarters.

384.title: London's V&A museum holds its first male fashion exhibition
384.article_body: London's V&A museum is holding its first exhibition dedicated to men's fashion. The 'Fashioning Masculinities: The Art of Menswear' exhibition would display menswear from centuries, including the 18th century to the present date, while shining light on designers, tailors and artists. "The approach to...show was to look at both fashion and art," senior curator of fashion Claire Wilcox said.

385.title: To oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress: Rebel leaders
385.article_body: After meeting post Congress' loss in recent Assembly polls, party's G-23 leaders said in order to oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress. The leaders demanded Congress to initiate dialogue with like-minded forces to create way for credible alternative for 2024 general elections. They added that only way forward for Congress is to adopt model of collective and inclusive leadership.

386.title: Only shows requesting position of Russian side: Ukraine on report of tentative peace plan
386.article_body: After Financial Times said Ukraine, Russia have drawn up tentative peace plan to end war, Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted, "FT published a draft, which represents requesting position of...Russian side. Nothing more." "Ukrainian side has its own positions. Only thing we confirm...is ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops and security guarantees from...countries," he said.

387.title: Germany records 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
387.article_body: Germany's Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Wednesday reported 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases. The country's seven-day incidence rate rose to a record 1,607 infections per 1,00,000 people for the first time over the past week. The RKI also reported 269 COVID-19 related deaths, raising the total death toll in Germany since the pandemic began to 1,26,142.

388.title: Barcelona sign shirt, stadium sponsorship deal with Spotify
388.article_body: Barcelona on Tuesday said it signed a shirt and stadium sponsorship deal with audio streaming site Spotify. The brand's name will appear on the front of the men's and women's team shirts for four years from the 2022/23 campaign onwards. The club's stadium will also be renamed to Spotify Camp Nou. The deal is reportedly worth over $300 million.

389.title: Anything can happen: Red Bull’s Verstappen ahead of Bahrain Grand Prix
389.article_body: Red Bull's Formula One world champion Max Verstappen believes that "anything can happen" ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. "The car looks good and as a team, we are in a good place," the 24-year-old said. "I'm looking forward to seeing where we are compared to the rest of the grid come qualifying on Saturday," he added.

390.title: Coming from a broken home, music was the only avenue I had: Shruti
390.article_body: Actress and musician Shruti Haasan in an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla shared her experience with music. "Coming from a broken home, and not having a way to express myself, music was the only avenue I had," the 36-year-old said on music being everything for her. She revealed she sang English numbers at a restaurant in Mumbai when nobody knew her.

391.title: I am going to relax, watch a movie: Pooja Hegde on her Holi plans
391.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla recently, actress Pooja Hegde opened up about her plans for Holi and said she's "going to relax and watch a movie". While sharing her childhood memories of the festival, she added, "Now as an actor, I...don't have the liberty of playing Holi because I am always shooting something...I don't want to take the risk.

392.title: Russia accuses Bangladeshi media of 'biased' coverage on Ukraine war
392.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Bangladesh, Alexander Mantytskiy, has written an open letter to Bangladeshi media outlets, accusing them of "biased" reportage on Ukraine invasion. Mantytskiy stated that the media outlets were following "anti-Russian propaganda", motivated by "prejudice". Reacting to it, a Bangladeshi news editor said that a foreign ambassador shouldn't tell journalists how to do their job.

393.title: Cong appoints leaders to assess situation after loss in 5 states
393.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday appointed senior leaders Jairam Ramesh, Ajay Maken, Jitendra Singh, Rajani Patil and Avinash Pandey to assess the post-poll situation and suggest organisational changes. This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states. Sonia had on Tuesday asked the party's state unit chiefs in these states to resign.

394.title: K'taka ACB raids 18 govt officials; gold necklaces, cars recovered
394.article_body: The Karnataka Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Wednesday conducted raids against 18 officers regarding disproportionate asset cases and started searches at 75 places across the state. ACB seized three cars, eight gold necklaces from Bengaluru's Traffic Safety Department's Additional Commissioner Gnanendra Kumar. ACB seized a bungalow belonging to engineer Ashok Reddy of Krishna Bhagya Jala Nigam.

395.title: Ukraine captures hacker who was allegedly helping Russian troops
395.article_body: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has captured a hacker that the country claims was helping the Russian troops with mobile communications in Ukraine. According to SBU, the hacker was allegedly helping to route calls from within Russia to the mobile phones of Russian troops in Ukraine. The hacker was also sending text messages to Ukrainian officers proposing they surrender.

396.title: Jharkhand break world record for taking highest-ever lead in a first-class match
396.article_body: Jharkhand have broken the world record for taking the highest-ever lead in a first-class match. Jharkhand took a total lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland in their Ranji Trophy 2021-22 pre-quarterfinal. Jharkhand were bowled out for 880 in their first innings before dismissing Nagaland for 289. Jharkhand scored 417/6 in their second innings as the match ended in a draw.

397.title: They made me feel ugly: Vidya on producers replacing her in films
397.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in a recent interview shared how producers replaced her in over a dozen films and behaved very badly with her. "They made me feel so ugly that for six months, I couldn't...look at myself in the mirror," she said. The 43-year-old recalled how during one such rejection she walked for hours and "cried a lot".

398.title: Record 4,00,000 new COVID-19 cases recorded in South Korea in 24 hours
398.article_body: South Korea reported a record 4,00,741 new daily COVID-19 cases, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Wednesday. According to the Associated Press, South Korea saw its deadliest day yet of the pandemic on Tuesday, with 293 deaths. South Korea is currently grappling with a record surge in coronavirus infections driven by the fast-moving omicron variant.

399.title: Pics show India's first rapid rail; can cover Delhi-Meerut distance in 55 minutes
399.article_body: The first look of India's first rapid rail, which will run on the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut corridor and cover a distance of 82 km in just 55 minutes, has been unveiled by National Capital Regional Transport Corporation. The upcoming RRTS trains will reportedly have 2×2 transverse seating, overhead luggage racks, CCTV cameras, sockets at every seat for laptop/mobile charging among other amenities.

400.title: Was asked to praise mediocre contestants: Sonu on Hindi reality shows
400.article_body: Singer Sonu Nigam has said that he has turned down several Hindi reality shows because he's tired of being asked to praise contestants even when the song isn't good. "I don't like that...I don't look forward to earning money and I don't see the necessity of being a part of a show just for the sake of it," he added.
